listings.description:
Job Description:

Role Summary/Purpose:

Our organization is looking for an Android Developer to join our Application Development team. You will be working hands on with a diverse team of developers to create and support native apps for Synchrony Financial, as well as a handful of retail clients.

The successful candidate has experience developing native Android apps that communicate with REST APIs. Experience with other capabilities such as Location Services and Push Notifications also a plus. A strong candidate will have source code and examples of their work they are readily available to share.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Work as part of a team of 1 to 3 Android developers to create apps according to the specifications of our clients and our client services team
  • Work closely with Project Managers on a daily basis to deliver projects on time in a fast paced agile environment
  • Implement code based on technical specifications provided through Functional Design Documents and/or Jira tickets
  • Participate in code reviews with other developers
  • Communicate effectively across teams and departments
  • Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned

Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Degree in Computer Science from a four-year university strongly preferred OR an equivalent mix of education and experience are also acceptable
  • Minimum 2 years experience programming Java, Android, and Android Studio
  • Experience with agile methodologies, Jira, git, and code reviews
  • Experience consuming data from REST APIs, preferably with JSON
  • At least one non-trivial app available for download

Desired Characteristics:

  • Familiarity with common design patterns and object oriented programming
  • Knowledge of Android, Java, and/or Python programming is helpful, but not required

Eligibility Requirements:

  • You must be 18 years or older
  • You must have a high school diploma or equivalent
  • You must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the onboarding process
  • You must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
  • New hires (Level 4-7) must have 9 months of continuous service with the company before they are eligible to post on other roles. Once this new hire time in position requirement is met, the associate will have a minimum 6 months’ time in position before they can post for future non-exempt roles. Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 24 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must have at least a “consistently meets expectations” performance rating and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance requirement).

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Reasonable Accommodation Notice:

  • Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.
  • If you need special accommodations, please call our Career Support Line so that we can discuss your specific situation. We can be reached at 1-866-301-5627. Representatives are available from 8am – 5pm Monday to Friday, Central Standard Time.

The salary range for this position is 52,000.00 - 110,000.00 USD Annual

Salaries are adjusted according to market in CA and Metro NY and some positions are bonus eligible.

Grade/Level: 09

Job Family Group:

Information Technology

listings.position: Full Stack Developer: Web and Mobile Apps
listings.description:
Full Stack Developer: Web and Mobile Apps

Build next-generation web and mobile apps for some of the most successful companies in the world.

Start date: Immediate Hire


Minimum qualifications:

  • 0-3 years working as a software engineer

  • Bachelor?s degree in STEM disciplines
  • Location: New York City. Eligibility to work in the US*.

(*Regarding work eligibility: Unfortunately, we are not currently in a position to sponsor visas of any kind. Our roles are not remote.)


This role is ideal for:

  • Aspiring CTO: You want an engineering management-track position that teaches you every facet of tech (coding, product, user research, business development). You want to develop technical and non-technical skills (communication, presentation, sales) that will prepare you to lead a global division or start your own company some day.

  • Tech realist: You want to build real-world solutions that are used by millions.
  • Client-friendly and team player: You enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams and interacting directly with clients.
  • Diverse project portfolio: You like large-scale projects, but appreciate the learning opportunities of a startup environment.
  • Global mindset and intellectual curiosity: You have the personal projects or interests to prove it.


Responsibilities:

  • From your first day on the job, you will develop web and mobile applications for our industry-leading clients.

  • Interact directly with decision makers (CEOs and CTOs, founders, managing directors, leads)

  • Collaborate in small agile teams of three to four developers, with support from the project?s tech lead and an agile coach

  • Divide your time between our office in Manhattan and client sites; occasional, but infrequent travel.


About us:


We develop web and mobile apps for industry leaders. Our clients approach us to develop their most complex web and mobile apps in record time. We combine world-class expertise in open-source technologies, precise implementation of Lean and Agile methodologies, and sharp business sense to build customized products that are used by millions worldwide.

We develop you into a CTO. For your valuable contributions, we want you to grow with us. We invest heavily in your professional training from day one through the entirety of your career at Theodo. You start with an intense three-week onboarding and continue to learn from every project you work on.

We also set you up for long-term success, supporting your path toward becoming the domain expert or technical leader that you want to become. A transparent advancement track outlines clear paths to your next promotion. Supervisors are equal parts managers and mentors, and as you progress, you will in turn become a manager and mentor of more junior Theodoers. If your interests include research, sales, or presenting the keynote speech at a technical conference, we will open those gates and encourage you to run through them.

We like to think that we offer the best of all worlds: the global impact of our elite, multinational clients, with the growth and velocity of the startup that we are, and the satisfaction of producing high-quality work while doing what we can to bring your own goals to life. Join us.

We are a team of 300 and located in NYC, London and Paris:

  • Established 10 years ago

  • Grew from 30 to 300 in the last 5 years

  • Financial Times FT1000 list of fastest-growing European companies for each of the last three years

  • And we co-host the React Native NYC Meetup!


Compensation package:

  • Dollars and cents:
    • Base salary: $80,000 - $110,000
    • Discretionary bonus for embedding with clients
    • Stipend for hardware purchases, accrued quarterly and rolled over continuously.
  • Physical, mental and financial wellness:
    • Comprehensive health, dental and vision insurance
    • Generous PTO:
      • Major federal holidays
      • 15 vacation days
      • One additional vacation day for every six months worked
    • 401K retirement plan
  • Company culture that supports professional and personal development:
    • Formal mentorship: Technical and Agile coaches on every project and throughout your career
    • Promotion track: Clear, transparent path for professional advancement
    • Travel: Opportunities to work from our international offices in the short- and long-term opportunities
    • Annual company-wide trip
    • Team atmosphere and camaraderie:
      • Monthly event or team dinner
      • Weekly meetups over coffee or drinks
      • JR?s tarte tatin, Mike?s British wit, and occasional sightings of Nico?s extremely bright Hawaiian shirt.

A diverse working environment

Theodo is committed to diversity and inclusion. We promote a prejudice-free environment and do not discriminate against current or prospective employees because of age, gender, ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or illness.

Who is Hybrid Apparel?

Hybrid Apparel designs, develops, sources, produces, and distributes apparel for the whole family. We provide apparel to all tiers and trade channels of distribution covering licensed, private label and branded apparel. From humble beginnings with men's t-shirt sales out of the back of a car in 1997, Hybrid has grown and evolved into one of the top competitors in the industry. The key to Hybrid’s success has always been its people, and we strive to bring on other hardworking individuals who will continue to propel us forward while holding to our values of creativity, respect, collaboration, giving and fun.


Job Summary

Responsible for managing the product creation process from design hand off to production, and strategically developing innovative product that aligns with Hybrid’s financial and product integrity goals


Job Responsibilities

  • Managing key development dates and coordinating meetings based on the calendar triggers
  • Guiding the development process based on the retail strategy of the customer
  • Communicating clearly and effectively daily with the design team and overseas factories
  • Providing alternative options for any problems or delays in the development process
  • Coming to Pre-Handover Meetings with quality standards from all factories for development fabrics
  • Coming to Handover Meetings with production BOMs completed
  • Requesting initial costing
  • Aligning with the Production Team on where to develop product/place production based on cost, delivery, capacity and quality
  • Developing new fabrics, washes and trims with overseas factories
  • Sizing art and entering samples requests in Unity/Portal/PLM
  • Coordinating domestic development sampling
  • Establishing a sourcing strategy based on analyzing vendor pricing and capabilities
  • Tracking to make sure submits arrive by their deadlines
  • Reviewing production qualities against the approved development qualities
  • Suppling the factories with timely thorough comments or approvals on their submits
  • Reviewing costing BOMs for accuracy and providing suggestions to better achieve design intent based on the factories capabilities
  • Participating in concept and development meetings
  • Staying informed on market trends and understanding the market landscape, price points and competition
  • Working with the Compliance Team to ensure that all garment components will pass testing requirements before they move into production
  • Making callouts of treatments and construction details that may not be executable in production
  • Proposing viable substitutions when initial costing for a product does not align with the target price
  • Critically reviewing the Component Costing received from factories and bringing any inconsistencies to their attention
  • Requesting L/Ds and sample yardage
  • Issuing art files, BOMs and patterns to the factories for garment sampling
  • Creating and updating all production BOMs
  • Archiving quality, color, and wash standards, so that the quality/color library is well maintained and accessible for the production/design teams
  • Accurately and consistently updating sample WIP
  • Ensuring that vendors send Fabric Information and Bulk Submit Sheets
  • Other duties may be assigned in accordance with company needs

Qualifications

  • 4 year degree in Textile, Fashion Merchandising, or equivalent years of experience
  • 2-3 years’ experience in product development, or production in garment manufacturing
  • Strong knowledge of fabric, costing and apparel development
  • Experience with WIP tracking to maintain calendar
  • Sound knowledge of international production process
  • Ability to set priorities, foster cohesion and provide motivation to cross functional teams
  • Superior organizational skills
  • Strong problem solving and negotiating skills
  • Clear and effective verbal and written communication
  • Experience in meeting facilitation and process implementation
  • Ability to maintain a cooperative team environment that promotes high performance standards and attainment of goals
  • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
  • Highly detail-oriented, meticulous and creative
  • Knowledge of garment/textile construction
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Flexible w/hours. Commits to hours necessary to reach goals and get jobs completed.

What Does Hybrid Offer?

As a Hybrid team member you will receive various benefits outside of standard medical, dental and vision insurance offerings. You can also expect a 4% 401k match, free basic life insurance, 8 company holidays, paid vacation and sick time, on-site car washes and massages, company discounts and complementary coffee service. This also includes access to our onsite gym that provides free fitness classes like kickboxing, spin/cycling, yoga, weight lifting, pilates and more.


Hybrid Apparel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Proof of eligibility to work in the United States is required. We do not sponsor H1-B or other visas.

Third party or agency inquiries will not be accepted.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee
Shift : Day Job
Travel : No
Job Posting : Oct 04 2019

About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 193 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.
Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.

Description

Do you want to be a part of something big? Are you a creative Web Developer? Do you operate well in a fun, high-energy environment? Are you a Team Player? Clarity is a profitable, growing business with customers ranging from small businesses to billion dollar enterprises. If you are passionate about developing and designing websites then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Clarity is seeking a Front end Web Developer who will be responsible for developing and updating dynamic web sites for our clients. You'll be joining a team that is creative, focused on results, and works together to achieve goals. The Web Developer is responsible for working with project managers and designers to build custom websites. This includes HTML and CSS coding, assisting in the QA, testing and the actual publishing of the websites. The Front end Web Developer will also assist in providing back-up design support when needed.

Requirements

  • High proficiency with the HTML/CSS/JavaScript backed by a sharp, critical eye for detail.
  • Proficiency with the implementation of cross-browser website designs using XHTML, CSS-based layouts and SEO-conscious/semantic markup.
  • Ability to turn sliced designs into professionally rendered, publish-ready deliverables.
  • JavaScript experience; DOM scripting; jQuery.
  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite – specifically Photoshop and ideally Illustrator.
  • Clean, standards-compliant HTML, CSS and JavaScript code with cross-browser compatibility.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 2+ year of professional web development with frontend focus.
  • Understanding of the web development lifecycle, including QA.
  • Experience communicating directly with clients.

Benefits

Health Insurance, Profit Sharing, Generous Paid Time Off, Leadership Opportunities, Positive and Educational Work Environment, Ongoing Training, Rapid Growth, Client Facing Experience, Weekly Team Lunches.

Interview Process

Please - no faxes or phone calls. NO THIRD PARTY CONTRACTORS, RECRUITERS, CORP TO CORP OR CONSULTANTS.

Local candidates only

The interview process will be thorough, including a personality test and a real world coding project. Apply only if you demand of yourself the same standards of excellence that you look for in your development team.

Please Note: We do not offer relocation at this time. We do not sponsor or transfer visas at this time.

To Apply

Email cover letter and resume to Careers@Clarity-Ventures.com.

Job Summary:
As part of the Technology team, the Web Developer I will maintain and support existing and new websites, eCommerce stores and other cloud-based solutions. S/he will work as part of a team to monitor and manage site content, UX, and ADA compliance. The Web Developer I will also provide support and improvements to legacy applications and tools. S/he will assist in formulating developer best practices and guidelines, improving team processes, and providing practical usable technical and user documentation.

  • This position is on-site at our Champaign, IL headquarters.
Essential Functions:
1. Modify existing programs following the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

2. Collaborate with technology and business so that new and modified solutions are user friendly, reliable, scalable, accessible, testable, and maintainable

3. Provide daily support for internal and customer-facing applications addressing problems’ root causes with workable solutions

4. Work with Project Leads in completing assigned project deliverables

5. Utilize project management tool according to departmental guidelines

6. Create and execute test plans that validate solution deliverables

7. Create useful and thorough technical documentation, such as flow diagrams, technical specifications, and application support and training material

8. Follow departmental change management procedure

9. Be effective and timely in communicating with other staff and teams

10. Follow programming best practices and standards

11. Monitor websites analytics, content and conformance to ADA standards

12. Support a culture of continuous improvement

13. Participate in on-call rotation

Education: 2-year programming degree, certifications, or equivalent experience required. 4-year degree Computer Science or comparable field preferred.

Required Experience: 1 year professional server-side application development and support experience. Good knowledge of CSS, HTML, JavaScript, MS SQL. Understanding of CMS and web applications.

Preferred Experience: 2 years professional experience supporting server-side web applications in a windows environment. Familiarity with JSON, Bootstrap. Experience with ASP.Net, C# or Liquid is a plus.

Required Competencies:
Accountability

Adaptability

Attention to detail

Computer literacy

Continuous learning

Customer focused

Data gathering and analysis

Decision making

Continuous learning

Quality oriented

Results oriented

Initiative

Oral communication

Written communication

Self confidence

Stress tolerance

Technical expertise

Integrity

Resourcefulness

Effort

Respect

Teamwork

Stewardship

Office Equipment: Frequent computer use, occasional phone use, and rare use of a copier.

Mental Demands: Frequent problem-solving, data interpretation, analysis, and reading/writing. Occasional decision-making and organization required.

﻿Physical Demands: ﻿Frequent sitting and occasional walking/standing.

﻿Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, Responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Are you passionate about software development and testing? Would you like a chance to apply what you have learned on a critical project? F5 Networks is offering the opportunity to join us on a summer internship. Interns at F5 work in collaboration with senior engineers who are eager to share knowledge as you contribute to the team.

In addition to participating on an interesting project, interns will be invited to our Seattle, WA, headquarters to join in on our “Boot Camp.” At this event, you will have the opportunity to learn details about our most successful products. There will also be plenty of social events, allowing you to get to know leaders throughout the F5 organization and your fellow interns!

Position Summary:


This is a technical internship position designed to provide qualified students an opportunity to learn valuable knowledge in a hands-on manner, doing development of unit tests for a gRPC service and extend code coverage. You’ll collaborate with leading software engineers to undertake a challenging project that will provide the opportunity for you to learn about new technologies, develop or enhance your skills, and make significant contributions to F5.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate along-side of one of F5’s key development efforts, the “Standalone TMM,” helping offload “bite-sized” activities from the primary developers and adding stability to the product
  • Learn tools that are “cutting-edge” in the Web-Services and CICD world: golang, gRPC, and protobuf

Applicants should be/possess:

  • A current student enrolled in a technical discipline, preferably Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
  • Approaching their Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship (exceptional Sophomore or Freshmen may be considered)
  • Available for a 10-12 week internship between June and September of 2020

Previous project work in the following, a plus:

  • Modern, object-oriented programming language

Internships are an excellent way to get to know F5. Internships at F5 may lead to full-time employment opportunities, so if you are looking to be a member of an amazing, exciting company, you have come to the right place!

***Please note that we cannot sponsor work Visas for these positions.

The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.

Description :

CLOSING DATE: This position will close on October 16, 2019.

The Developer Analyst II is responsible for management, implementation, and hands on development of Black Hills' HCM, Finance, and Property Accounting systems. These critical systems support our assets, employees, and customers across multiple utilities, states, regulatory jurisdictions, and bargaining units. In this role you will work with business partners to define the scope of business needs and translate processes from detailed functional requirements to technical design specifications. This includes the support of multiple modules and 50+ mission critical interfaces to internal and external systems.

LOCATION: Rapid City, SD; Denver, CO; Papillion, NE

  • A Comprehensive Relocation Plan is offered for this position! Our benefits include but are not limited to: home finding trip, transportation of household goods, temporary housing expenses, destination apartment search assistance, paid time off to move, transition and spousal career support, home finder and purchase assistance, relocation adjustment allowance, destination new purchase closing costs. Depending on individual circumstances, our benefit may also include trips home during temporary housing, renter’s lease cancellation assistance, or home marketing and sale closing cost assistance and/or purchase closing cost assistance. Contents of our relocation program are subject to change and may vary based on position.

SALARY RANGE: $67,100 - $87,290 (Base salary is determined by the knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant.)

REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: IT Application Manager

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Take proactive steps to evaluate issues, determine alternatives, and implement the appropriate solution.
  • Develop strong relationships with end users to effectively troubleshoot problems and recommend good solutions.
  • Responsible for hands-on development and implementation of change requests.
  • Support of multiple modules and mission critical interfaces to internal and external systems.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Discuss and explain technical implementations to project staff, business users, and management, either verbally or in writing
  • Ensure compliance with technical best practices, policies, standards, and software licensing.
  • Accountable for change management and SOX compliance
  • Stay abreast of changes and advances in technology that could affect the company.
  • Track, monitor, and report progress of assignments
  • Perform end-user training.

WORKING RELATIONSHIPS:

  • Will work with and coordinate efforts across all departments within IT.
  • Will maintain a relationship with multiple business groups and understand their needs and priorities.

EXPERIENCE:

  • 3+ years of related experience supporting an Enterprise Resource Planning System.
  • PeopleSoft and/or Hyperion experience desired.

EDUCATION:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field or equivalent combination of education and experience required

SKILLS/ABILITY/OTHER CHARACTERISTICS:

  • Demonstrated experience with hands on ERP platforms across various HR and/or Financial modules.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in working in ERP software development environments (PeopleSoft or Hyperion preferred but not required)
  • Ability to generate and execute accurate and efficient Oracle SQL statements
  • Experience designing, building, testing, and troubleshooting system to system interfaces.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Demonstrated ability to be agile and respond quickly to shifting priorities.
  • Requires strong interpersonal skills and excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Self-starter with excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently with ease, while maintaining a strong focus on detail.
  • Ability to demonstrate strong troubleshooting skills and lead high-visibility efforts.
  • Capacity to work well independently, as well as in a team, with the ability to collaborate with other team members and foster a team environment.
  • High level of integrity as position has a high level of access to extremely confidential data.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Applicant must be able to perform the essential job functions of the position with or without accommodation.

About our Company: We are a customer focused, growth-oriented utility company that is devoted to our communities. We have a mission to improve life with energy and a vision to be the energy partner of choice. Our diverse culture sparks unique perspectives, opening doors to new ideas and possibilities. Based in Rapid City, South Dakota, we have over 2800 employees and serve 1.2 million natural gas and electric utility customers across eight states (South Dakota, Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, Nebraska, Iowa, Kansas, and Arkansas).

Enjoy our Comprehensive Benefits Package: annual incentive program, 401(k) (6% company match and up to 9% company retirement contribution), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, additional Veteran PTO, military leave differential pay, paid holidays and annual floating holidays, company paid short term and long term disability, paid maternity and paternity benefits, health and wellness program, and competitive medical, dental and vision insurance.

The information contained in this position description describes the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. This description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, duties, and requirements for employees in this position. The incumbent is responsible for performing all duties in a safe and efficient manner in compliance with safe work procedures and safety regulations. This job description is not intended to constitute an offer or contract of employment. Job descriptions may and do change periodically.

Black Hills Energy does not sponsor applicants for work visas. All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US.

We are an EEO Employer.

Description

Join the Nebraska State Patrol as a temporary IT Applications Developer. You can become part of our diverse culture that creates and maintains custom law enforcement applications supporting the Nebraska State Patrol statewide. Join our team to support the highest quality of law enforcement and ensure safe communities in Nebraska.

This advertisement is for a temporary position that is expected to last until September 30, 2020.

Examples of Work

The IT Applications Developer will design and build the forms necessary for the records management system. The Developer will create the business logic and backend rules for the forms and records. The Developer will create and document the business rules for the fields and field validation. The Developer will develop the process flow of these files, interfacing to supporting systems within the agencies. Knowledge of software development principles and methods; basic math skills, testing procedures, programming and documentation. Primary programs used include C#.NET, ASP.NET, MVC, and HTML as well as custom law enforcement applications and tools. Develop and maintain databases using relational data modeling techniques. Create SQL database tables, views, functions, stored procedures, and scripts. Revise existing databases in response to changing technology and/or customer needs. Test applications, lead users in testing, and resolve reported issues. Keep current with recent developments within the industry and new technologies. Reviews and incorporates best practices including object oriented design, criminal justice information security and NITC standards related to application development. Understand the flow of criminal justice information between systems and agencies. Maintain clear lines of communication with supervisor, peers, staff, and personnel in affected NSP divisions. Participate in the full range of software development activities, including assisting with requirements gathering; analysis and definition; functional and technical design; coding and testing; implementation, and production support with limited supervision.

Qualifications / Requirements

REQUIREMENTS: Experience, education or training in coding computer applications.

PREFERRED: Associate or Bachelor's degree in a related field such as computer science, computer engineering or management information systems with experience in programming. Experience or training in designing web and desktop applications using C#.NET, ASP.NET, Web Forms and MVC, and Microsoft SQL Server software development, database reporting, and object-oriented programming. Knowledge of data warehouse tools, SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Reporting Services, Team Foundation Server, SharePoint, and SharePoint services. Exceptional written and oral communication skills. Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on listening and questioning skills. Strong documentation skills. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Exceptional customer service orientation.

OTHER: If selected for this position, you must meet the U.S. Citizenship & Immigration Services employment eligibility requirements by completing an EEV (I-9) Form. The agency does not sponsor H1-B Visa's. Resumes will not be accepted as a substitute to your applicant information. Failure to complete all areas of your employment application may result in your application being disqualified from our selection process. Must successfully complete an extensive background screening prior to being employed which includes completion of a Personal History Questionnaire. Applicants will be screened for a record of criminal activity and criminal history using a fingerprint-based check, and before unconditional employment is offered. Applicants must be free of felony convictions, and cannot maintain continuous association or dealings with persons, groups, or organizations that they know, or should know, are persons or groups or organizations under criminal investigation or indictment or who have a reputation for present, ongoing involvement in felonious or criminal behavior. Selection process will include an interview.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of software development principles and methods; project management techniques; agency business processes and functions; windows forms, web forms, XML parsing, MVC frameworks, entity framework and source code version control systems. Ability to apply programming languages; read, listen, and understand information and ideas presented; reason inductively; communicate orally and in writing, information and ideas, so others will understand; reason deductively; think logically; organize, plan and prioritize work; provide guidance to less experienced coworkers; test, install, implement, document and maintain software; design, code, test and debug large and complex computer applications; maintain source code; modify and upgrade code as necessary; design and maintain complex SQL scripts; keep up-to-date and use job relevant knowledge. Skill in analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design; applying systems engineering concepts an factors; writing, debugging and maintaining code in C#.NET and ASP.NET, logical/physical database design; database principles and methodologies; design and maintain complex SQL scripts. Create interfaces between applications.

What We Are Looking For

We currently have an opening on our Application Solutions team for a Database Developer. The Database Developer you will play a central and important role in building and maintaining the database systems used by students and faculty at NEP.

A successful candidate for this position will:

  • Have a passion for database development and quality
  • Enjoy aggressively finding solutions for challenging problems
  • Be able to communicate these solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Be comfortable supporting legacy production database systems as well as helping determine a migration path to a cloud architecture

Job Description:

Role Summary/Purpose:

The Identity Access Management (IAM) SSO Senior Developer is responsible for designing, developing, maintaining authentication scripts and login pages for Synchrony’s access management solutions including, but not limited to, Single Sign On & Federation, Directory Services, Multifactor Authentication, and Web Access Management. The person is also responsible for automating the Infrastructure builds and writing reusable cookbooks for applications to move to modern authentication standards such as OpenID Connect, OAuth etc. The person must be able to work independently in a fast-paced environment on highly complex requirements. Hands on coding experience is a must.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • The ideal candidate for this role will embrace the exciting blend of technical expertise, engagement ability and leadership that is required to be successful.
  • Design, develop and maintain Synchrony’s custom access management login pages and scripts
  • Develop strategy for modernizing authentication capabilities for Synchrony’s legacy applications.
  • Develop reusable cookbooks for SAML, OAuth, OpenID integrations.
  • Develop automated build processes for Access Management code releases using Jenkins/GIT and create a CI/CD pipeline.
  • Successfully transition support and knowledge of new developments/enhancements/automated builds to Synchrony’s SSO operations and engineering teams
  • Provide expertise for IDaaS API usage to Synchrony’s application teams.
  • Provide engineering integration support for application authentication and authorization.
  • Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned

Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering or related field, with a minimum of 10 years of experience in Information Security OR in lieu of the bachelor’s degree, a minimum of 15 years of experience in Information Security
  • Minimum 7 years of implementation experience with SSO and federation using SAML 2.0, Oauth, OIDC.
  • Minimum 2 years working experience with implementing Identity Broker Solution with Okta and Ping Identity
  • Minimum 5 years Java development experience

Desired Characteristics:

  • Self-Directed, High Energy
  • Ability to work well with a team in a fast-paced agile development environment.
  • Excellent oral/written communication & listening skills will be necessary to present information, analysis & recommendations to all levels of employees, including senior engineers and managers.
  • Hands on experience in designing, developing and deploying cloud-based solution using AWS
  • Understanding of core AWS services, uses, and basic architecture best practices
  • Experience supporting Apache and WebLogic
  • Experience with Chef/Docker is a plus
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and processes
  • Understanding of Microservices Architecture
  • Minimum 5 years power shell scripting and Perl experience

Eligibility Requirements:

  • You must be 18 years or older
  • You must have a high school diploma or equivalent
  • You must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the onboarding process
  • You must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
  • New hires (Level 4-7) must have 9 months of continuous service with the company before they are eligible to post on other roles. Once this new hire time in position requirement is met, the associate will have a minimum 6 months’ time in position before they can post for future non-exempt roles. Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 24 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must have at least a “consistently meets expectations” performance rating and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance requirement).

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Job Summary:

Sr Edifecs Developers are responsible for development, programming, coding of Information Technology solutions. Developers are responsible for documenting detailed system specifications, participation in unit testing and maintenance of planned and unplanned internally developed applications, evaluation and performance testing of purchased products. Developers are responsible for including IT Controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, as well as availability of the application and data processed or output by the application. Write code for moderately complex system designs. Write programs that span platforms. Code and/or create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs). Write code for enhancing existing programs and/or developing new programs.

Essential Functions:

  • Report missing elements found in system and functional requirements and explain impacts on subsystem to team members.
  • Consult with other Developers, Business Systems Analysts, Project Managers and vendors.
  • “Scope” time, resources, etc., required to complete programming projects.
  • Seek review from other Developers, Business Systems Analysts or Project Managers on estimates. Perform unit testing and debugging. Set test conditions based upon code specifications
  • Supports transition of application throughout the Product Development life cycle.
  • Document what has to be migrated.
  • Researches vendor products / alternatives. Conducts vendor product gap analysis / comparison.
  • Accountable for including IT Controls and following standard corporate practices to protect the confidentiality, integrity, as well as availability of the application and data processed or output by the application.
  • Tier 1 Production support


Minimum Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in an IT related field or equivalent work experience
  • 7 years' related work experience or combination of education in progressively responsible information technology
  • Experience and understanding with unit testing, release procedures, coding design and documentation protocol as well as change management procedures
  • Proficiency using versioning tools
  • Strong knowledge of the Healthcare industry, including X12 and HL7 transactions
  • In-depth understanding of the Edifecs Smart Trading Platform
  • Experience developing Edifecs Guidelines (X12, XML, and flat file formats)
  • Experience developing complex Edifecs maps, templates, routes, including Validation; calls to external services (MQ, web service, and REST); translation, and TM integration, Error handling/replay, and performance tuning
  • Experience configuring Edifecs TPM, including the following: Partners, Agreements, and Relationships
  • Experience with XES Manager


Preference:

  • Experience troubleshooting production issues on the Edifecs Smart Trading Platform
  • 4 or more years of IT development/programming/coding professional work experience

Are you a front-end developer who is passionate about building awesome web pages, and have an interest in information security? Would you like a chance to apply what you have learned on a critical project? F5 Networks is offering the opportunity to join us on a summer internship with the F5 Labs team. Interns at F5 work in collaboration with senior engineers and designers who are eager to share knowledge as you contribute to the team.

In addition to participating on an interesting project, interns will be invited to our Seattle, WA, headquarters to join in on our 3 day “Boot Camp.” At this event, you will have the opportunity to learn details about our most successful products. There will also be plenty of social events, allowing you to get to know leaders throughout the F5 organization and your fellow interns!

Position Summary:

This internship position is designed to provide qualified students an opportunity to learn valuable knowledge in a hands-on manner as a key player in planned summer 2020 F5Labs.com website updates, specifically working on integrating automated threat intelligence that feeds into visually-appealing attacks maps on the home page. You’ll collaborate with multiple departments to undertake a challenging project that will provide the opportunity for you to learn about new technologies, develop or enhance your skills, and make significant contributions to F5.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in conjunction with our F5 Labs threat analysts, back-end developers, consultants and design team to enhance and implement the automated visual attack maps we have developed for F5Labs.com
  • Assist in improving the existing design with the F5 Labs team and work to develop new functional displays of existing threat data
  • Commit code within our development system and work through bugs found in testing until the solution is production ready

Applicants should be/possess:

  • A current student enrolled in a technical discipline, preferably Software Development or Computer Science
  • Approaching their Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship (exceptional Sophomore or Freshmen may be considered)
  • Available for a 10-12 week internship between June and September of 2020
  • Experience performing front-end developer work
  • Develop in Javascript, AngularJS, React, etc.
  • An interest in information security, big data and data presentation is a must!

Internships are an excellent way to get to know F5. Internships at F5 may lead to full-time employment opportunities, so if you are looking to be a member of an amazing, exciting company, you have come to the right place!

Summary

Posted: May 17, 2019
Role Number: 200038211
Apple's Compiler Runtime team is looking for a runtime expert to work on the Swift and Objective-C runtime libraries. This software is at the heart of Apple's products, so your contributions in this role will have a huge impact. The ideal candidate will love working on low-level multithreaded system software, creatively handling performance tradeoffs, and even dropping down to assembly code when necessary. The runtime support for Swift is part of the open-source Swift project (https://swift.org), so you will engage with the Swift community on a regular basis. Because the runtime libraries play such a central role in Apple's software platforms, you will also interact with a variety of other teams throughout the company. Swift has grown rapidly since it was introduced in 2014, but we have ambitious goals and there are many exciting features to support in the runtime.
Key Qualifications
  • Strong programming skills with C++ and related development tools
  • Low-level performance tuning experience, including a thorough knowledge of the performance behavior of modern processor architectures
  • Exceptional debugging skills
  • Experience writing thread-safe code while maintaining high performance
  • Commitment to constant improvement of software development practices, especially careful attention to testing
  • You bring passion and dedication to your job and are committed to building a quality product
Description
The Swift and Objective-C runtimes provide the low-level support for these programming languages, implementing things like reference counting and method dispatch. As a runtime engineer, you will work on all aspects of these libraries. High performance is key for this code, so you will need to carefully evaluate changes to squeeze out every last drop of speed. You will design and implement support for new products and features in close collaboration with other teams, so strong communication and teamwork skills will be important. A significant component of this job will be maintaining the existing code and investigating reports of problems from both internal Apple engineers and external app developers. Those problems are often hard to reproduce so you will need to figure out the causes from a few clues and find creative ways to collect more information when necessary. Come join us to help solve these challenges! The position is based onsite at Apple's campus in Cupertino, California. International candidates are welcome to apply but will need to relocate; the company will sponsor a visa.
Education & Experience
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Additional Requirements

The following are desirable but not required:

  • Deep understanding of Objective-C and Swift
  • Experience with programming language implementation
  • Experience contributing to open source projects

At Blue Raster, we pride ourselves in developing applications and tools that help our clients solve, clarify, and visualize many of the world’s critical challenges. Since 2002, we’ve partnered at the senior level with leading global organizations, helping them share their unique stories through the powerful visual medium of interactive maps.

THE POSITION

Blue Raster is seeking an experienced Power BI Developer with 2+ years of professional experiences with Power BI and data analysis. This position will mostly focus on data analysis and production efforts in support of an international project focused on ending the HIV epidemic (and other GIS related projects) in our Arlington, VA office. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual to work in an exciting multi-disciplinary environment among a team of talented and dedicated professionals in a variety of fields including Health, Conservation, Government, Global Affairs, and Education. The position offers great potential for professional growth and the opportunity to deliver engaging web and mobile BI and mapping applications that have a direct impact on our clients and their global missions.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Building enterprise models using Power BI desktop
  • Develop tabular, multidimensional models compatible to warehouse standards
  • Develop self-service models, data analytics using power BI service
  • Develop, publish, schedule reports and dashboards to meet business requirements
  • Assist on functional and data requirements to enhance data models
  • Requirement analysis, design and prototyping
  • Work with in-country teams both remotely and in-person to deliver end to end solutions

Requirements

  • BS in computer science, information systems or comparable experience
  • 2 years experience working with Microsoft Business Intelligence stack - dataset ingestion, data model creation, reports, dashboards, KPIs, Power BI Pro features, workspaces, security, etc.
  • 2 years of experience with self-service analytics tools (Power BI)
  • DHIS2 experience a plus
  • 2 years experience with SQL, database administration a plus
  • Knowledge of R, SAS, STATA and or/SPSS
  • Interest in data visualization, dashboards and mapping technologies
  • GIS experience, including Esri ArcGIS or geospatial technology a plus
  • Experience working with non-profits and/or foreign government ministries a plus
  • Must be legally eligible to work in the United States, we cannot sponsor H1B Visas
  • Some travel to Africa and/or Asia may be required

Benefits

Located in the vibrant, metro-accessible Court House neighborhood of Arlington, Virginia, Blue Raster offers a friendly work environment, competitive salaries, and a generous benefits package. Our benefits package includes:

  • CareFirst Medical, Dental, Vision with HSA option
  • 401k with 4% employer match
  • Paid Time Off and Personal Time that starts on your first day

  • Metro Benefits
  • Bike-friendly office

  • Support for personal and career growth

We also provide opportunities to work on a number of concurrent projects with clients from a variety of sectors, including Conservation, Health, Government, Global Affairs, and Education.


Our team is passionate about what we do, our clients, and how our work makes a positive impact on our world. Apply now to join our team of exceptional people!

COMPANY DESCRIPTION:

Canoe has created a new era in data operations. We are the first technology that automates highly frustrating, time-consuming, and costly manual workflows related to alternative investments and complex portfolios. Our proprietary SaaS-based technology intelligently recognizes, validates and reads unstructured investment data across asset classes, ownership structures and document types. With Canoe, our clients have smart, streamlined, and trusted data at their fingertips, enabling them to focus on what really matters. We offer a ground floor opportunity to join a team and the ability for you to share in our future success.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Canoe is recruiting talented, innovative and enthusiastic developers with varied levels of experience that also thrive in a team environment. Canoe utilizes technology to intelligently track investments for complex portfolios of alternative funds, illiquid investments, and liquid securities. The product is built using PHP, Python, Laravel Framework, MySQL, Javascript, Vue.js and other open source technologies. Canoe is independently capitalized and generating revenue.

WE OFFER:

  • A vital role in a rapidly-growing technology company with a great culture.
  • Ground floor opportunity to build out processes that makes an impact on a daily basis.
  • Exposure to product management, asset management, business strategy and software engineering concepts.
  • Stable funding base along with competitive salary and benefits.

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • 1 or more years of web applications development experience

The Junior Software Developer will work side-by-side with seasoned professionals, software architects, software developers, and analysts to design, develop and unit test software artifacts to fulfill the requirements of JBS’s Government, Nonprofit and commercial clients. The Junior Software Developer will act in a variety of roles to learn the full spectrum of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) in a professional setting, acting as business and systems analysts, developers, designers, QA analysts and testers, database administrators and more, all with the mentorship and tutelage of seasoned professionals in every area. If you have the desire and aptitude to learn new tools and techniques in a fast-paced environment, JBS is the place for you. You will learn to lead the industry by applying innovative, cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems with a technology agnostic posture. You should be at ease working in a collaborative team environment.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing and operations, and adheres to software development practices set by the company and the project
  • Participate in design discussions with the software architect and the team to produce comprehensible design documents
  • Review and refactor existing code to maximize efficiency, performance, modularity and reusability
  • Participate in code review sessions to learn cooperatively with fellow interns and more experienced developers, supplying constructive criticism and enhancement suggestions
  • Create clean, efficient code with minimal defects to meets customer requirements
  • Perform unit testing on new artifacts and assists with regression testing and test automation to maintain quality software artifacts

Education: College student (at least Junior status) pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a similar discipline.

Experience using integrated development environment (IDE) such as IntelliJ IDEA, Visual Studio, PHPStorm or WebStorm.

Skills: Able to review design and code artifacts for organization, modularity, and sound practices. Able to communicate technical details effectively. Willingness to learn and apply whatever technology is necessary to fulfill the requirements of JBS and our customers

About Digital Scientists LLC

Atlanta based software innovation lab with an integrated team of innovative designers, developers and strategists who enjoy working together to create digital products that solve clients’ problems. Description

Entertainment Group Technology Internships
Here at AT&T, you have an opportunity to get an edge on your future as an intern in the AT&T Entertainment Group Technology Internship Program. We won’t have you file papers and make copies… we offer students much more. Like getting hands-on with state of the art technology and working to bring the latest in content and entertainment to customers in their homes and on-the-go. Can’t stop watching sports, TV, movies, and news? We need you and your obsession with innovating entertainment to make an impact on our customers and business. It’s your front row seat to the exposure and opportunity that goes along with an internship at AT&T. Get ready for show time.
The Entertainment Group Technology Internship Program goes above and beyond your daily project work; networking events with peers, breakfast with leaders, code camp, case study work, resume reviews, etc. Don’t forget the fun stuff – social events, volunteer days, and even go behind the scenes by touring our broadcast centers and our live Rich Eisen Studio.
In our 12-week paid summer internship, you’ll work on projects that allow you to collaborate and form valuable mentorships with top minds in our company. Being involved with this program not only prepares you to apply for a position with us once you graduate, but also prepares you for the professional world regardless of where you work.
Along with the technical skills listed below for each internship, you should have the following;
  • Be actively pursuing a four-year degree with a STEM focus
  • Able to comprehend and communicate technical problems both in writing and verbally
  • Demonstrate initiative and ability to thrive in a team environment
Ready to learn more? Check out our different Entertainment Group Technology internships.
Software Engineering Internship
Experience what it takes to launch a successful career as a software engineer, using your design and coding know-how to enable access to content across multiple viewing platforms. Your big idea could shape how millions of customers experience the winning touchdown or binge-watch their favorite shows through our Set-Top Box and mobile apps or discover new ways to bring TV to life with Interactive Television.
Technical skills required will vary by role and could include: Software development in Swift, Java, C/C++, or scripting languages (shell, groovy, perl, etc.), Linux operating systems, SOAP and REST web services, Structured Query Language (SQL), Knowledge of Hadoop and related data analytics technologies, and Networking protocols.
Entertainment Systems Internship
As an intern, you can experience what it takes to launch a successful career designing and implementing the backend software and infrastructure that drives content across our viewing platforms and powers our big data initiatives. Your idea could shape how we deliver the winning touchdown and binge-worthy shows to millions of customers through digital broadcast TV, live streaming and on-demand IP video, or big data initiatives that find new ways to better the entertainment experience.
In this internship you could do a variety of roles: Software engineering, Software architecture, Content Delivery, Quality assurance, Subsystem engineering, Network engineering, System administration and Infrastructure planning.
Technical skills required will vary by role and could include: Software development in Python, Java, C/C++, or scripting languages (shell, groovy, perl, etc.), Linux operating systems, SOAP and REST web services, Structured Query Language (SQL), Knowledge of Hadoop and related big data technologies, and Networking protocols.
Broadcast Operations Internship
As an intern, you will work together with top minds to develop new monitoring scripts, document tasks and applications, and deploy new servers all the way from racking to software setup. You’ll also gain exposure to IP and SAN networks, RAID arrays, Oracle and DB2 databases, and even java-based applications running on Linux and Windows-based servers.
Find out what it takes to succeed in a fast-paced 24x7 operational environment at one of our Broadcast Operations centers in El Segundo or Los Angeles, California. With real-world impacts on everything from broadcast and interactive applications to DIRECTV On Demand and subscriber authentication, you’ll be front and center to solve issues in real-time, so our customers never miss those must-watch moments.
In this internship, you’ll work in one of the following positions: Engineer, Software Engineer, Network Engineer, Operations Engineer, Dynamic Advertising, and Advertisement Monitoring/Metric Enhancement.
By applying to the Entertainment Group Technology Internship Program, we will work closely with you to ensure you are also considered for other AT&T Technology programs at all AT&T locations throughout the US.
AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position.

We are looking for a strong Senior Voice Developer to join our NYC office and report directly into RAIN’s CTO and collaborate on development decisions for our clients. Developers are drawn to our perfect score of 12 on the “Joel Test” (look it up). We value proven experience but we don’t believe it is possible to learn to code in 24 hours and make valuable contributions to a project; our expectations are realistic!


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with RAIN’s strategy, UX/VX, and creative teams; interact with clients, exploring and advising technological possibilities, discovering solutions that fit their goals
  • Intermediary between cross-functional teams, clients, and programmers
  • Collaborate and consult with RAIN’s developers on all project work
  • Architect and develop large-scale, well-written applications
  • Write clean, structured, object-oriented code with change and reuse in mind
  • Build large applications and websites, such as interactive dashboards, e-commerce websites, corporate websites, and marketing destinations
  • Make complex problems seem simple using clean architecture and innovative UIs

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 7-10 years of experience in developer or technical lead roles
  • Be a full-stack web developer, with a primary language of node.js or PHP
  • Strong knowledge and experience of JavaScript or TypeScript
  • Organized, well-spoken, and confident leader
  • Experienced in web development, and leading a development team
  • Understanding of Amazon Web Services, Azure, or other cloud environments
  • Passionate about automating testing and version control guru
  • Comfortable on the command line and working with containers
  • Capability to teach and recommend common design patterns and programming best practices
  • Expert experience with one or more MVC frameworks
  • Strong experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Performance and Security minded
  • Ability to develop product user stories and estimate development costs

NICE TO HAVE:

  • Experience building Amazon Alexa skills or Google Assistant Actions
  • Ability to develop projects using JavaScript frameworks like VueJS or AngularJS
  • Familiarity with Prismic.io or Wordpress
  • Integration with common social network API's
  • Experience using other languages for web development, such as Java, C#, Ruby, or Python
  • Demonstrated experience with mobile platforms such as Android, iOS, or React Native
  • Experience with enterprise CMS such as Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) or SiteCore

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. RAIN will not sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future for this role.

The George Washington Department of Communications & Marketing is seeking a Web Developer, Drupal responsible for the back-end development and maintenance. Allstate Information Security is looking to hire a Cybersecurity Exploit Developer to join an exciting team and fulfill a high-demand service. The individual will perform duties such as program analysis, binary reverse engineering, live software patching, and automated vulnerability identification. He/she will discover security vulnerabilities and weaknesses and provide remediation recommendations. The primary targets will include in-house developed web applications, infrastructure, mobile applications, or IoT devices. The team is looking for an experienced researcher with a willingness to share knowledge and work with the team to enhance the security posture of Allstate’s applications and systems.

Key Responsibilities
  • Perform white and black box testing of in-house applications and systems with a variety of commercial and opensource tools
  • Build code independently or collaboratively to develop prototypes that address challenging security problems
  • Design evidence-based experiments that address stated research problems
  • Stay up-to-date in current tools, techniques, and vulnerabilities
  • Measure effectiveness of prototypes and provide reproducible results
  • Create detailed plans for maturing technologies beyond their prototype
  • Devise creative and custom exploits, solutions, and techniques to discover vulnerabilities and exploitability of the targets
  • Knowledge-share with team on techniques to continuously improve the service offering
  • Create detailed report of findings and recommendations after testing is complete and present to stakeholders
Job Qualifications
  • 5+ years experience with exploit development
  • Demonstrable knowledge and experience with Ida Pro, gdb, OllyDebug, Ghidra
  • Experience testing/analyzing applications and network protocols
  • Able to build, test, and maintain software using C/C++ and Python
  • Understanding of common network protocols
  • Working knowledge with various operating systems
  • Ability to relay detailed technical concepts to a broad range of audiences via written reports
  • Passion for continuous learning, growth, and tinkering


The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

We are seeking forward-thinking analysts to join our small cross-functional product teams that are creating and/or modernizing solutions using the latest design patterns and technologies. A fast-paced and outcome-focused approach allows product teams the autonomy to own the work and deliver business and technical capabilities.

Office Location (Bloomington, IL) …where we work hard AND play hard!

About Bloomington, IL:

All positions will be located in Bloomington, IL. Bloomington is the location of State Farm's Corporate Headquarters and is 2 1/2 hours from Chicago, Indianapolis, and St. Louis. Bloomington is a mid-size community; an average 15 minute rush hour commute is a welcome change for those who have fought rush hour traffic in the city. The community is very active and is home to multiple universities including Illinois State University and Illinois Wesleyan University.

We Are Looking for Candidates With

State Farm is looking for Software Developers to join us in creating the next generation of cloud-based predictive analytic and operational services that leverage big data and scale to speed underwriting analysis and decision-making, increase automation and improve the customer experience.

We are looking for someone who is a motivated self-starter, who loves to learn new technologies and put them to practical use, and is interested in engaging with a small dedicated team of developers. This team is utilizing agile practices to lead the way into industry-disruptive applications in the cloud.

Required Qualifications/Experiences:

  • Object Oriented Development: Java preferred.
  • Functional Development: Clojure preferred.
  • Testing frameworks: JUnit, Mockito, or similar.
  • Web Frameworks: Spring MVC or similar.
  • Web Service Knowledge: SOAP and/or RESTful web services, AWS.
  • Source Control Management: Git or similar.
  • IDE Usage: Eclipse-based IDEs, Atom or similar.
  • Other Technologies: ODM, Spark, Terraform, Kafta.
  • Ability to quickly adapt to a changing and fast-paced agile development environment.
  • Exhibits DevOps mindset where team is accountable for product from inception to sunset.

Competencies desired:

  • Technical/Functional Expertise
  • Decision Making & Judgment
  • Critical Thinking
  • Adaptability
  • Initiative
  • Communication

  • Next Steps: Competitive candidates may be invited to participate in the interview process. This is where the excitement begins!

  • A Learning Culture: Mentoring, Professional Designations, Employee Development, and more!

As a JavaScript Developer, you will provide programming support for new and existing Angular system development projects with broad-based undertakings. Primarily this will include writing computer programs, providing technical expertise, development of system testing processes, systems analysis, and performing top-tier support. This position will be primarily responsible for developing Angular (4+) applications against a RESTful backend.

This position is eligible for possible vacation credit for related service that meets certain criteria and offers a real work/life balance. The selected candidate will be supporting applications that both provide environmental data to the public, and assist the Pollution Control Agency in protecting and improving Minnesota's environment and human health. Come join this growing team!



Qualifications


Minimum Qualifications:

Candidates must clearly demonstrate all of the following qualifications in their resume:

Position requires a minimum of three (3) years of IT related experience supporting web application development which includes one year of Angular 2+ or other modern JavaScript framework such as React, Ember, Angular1, etc..

Experience must also include:

  • writing web interfaces in HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • modern JavaScript Framework (e.g., Angular, React, Ember, Vue)

A Master’s degree in Information Technology or a related field substitutes for three years of experience, OR a related Bachelor’s degree substitutes for two years, OR a related Associate’s substitutes for one year.

**Successful candidate must pass past-employer reference checks and a criminal history verification**

It is the policy of the Minnesota IT Services that all employees submit to a background investigation prior to employment. The background check may consist of the following components:

  • SEMA4 Records Check (applies to current and past state employees only)
  • Criminal History Check
  • Employment Reference Check
  • Social Security and Address Verification
  • Education Verification


**Minnesota IT Services will not sponsor applicants for work visas. All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US.**


Preferred Qualifications:

Extensive experience with Angular 2+

Experience with custom RESTful APIs

Experience working with formal project management

Experience with modern source control and deployment technologies

Experience with C# .NET or PHP

Proven experience working in complex systems

Proven understanding of ES2015+, Typescript, and RxJS fundamentals.

Superior written and verbal communication skills

Experience working in a collaborative environment with technical and non-technical professionals of varying backgrounds and specialties.



Application Details

listings.position: Software Developer Analyst I or II (CIS)
listings.description:
Description :

Job Specifications

CLOSING DATE: This position will close on October 10, 2019.

The CIS Software Developer Analyst position will work under general to minimal supervision and will work with senior and principal developer’s as needed to learn more about the CIS and language it is developed in while completing work assignments. Working with fellow CIS developers while working on assignments will be important in order to learn more about the technical and business aspects of the CIS. This will be done with also interacting with clients and team members to gather requirements for the analysis of business problems, determine feasible solutions to problems, and submit proposed solutions to fellow developers and team members. The position will develop specifications, construct, enhance, and maintain programs. Application documentation will also need to be created and maintained.

PAY RANGE: (Determined by the knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant.)
Software Developer Analyst I: $21 - $28 per hour
Software Developer Analyst II: $67,100 - 87,290 annually

STARTING DATE: The start date for this position is scheduled for May 2020.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: Application Development Supervisor

LOCATION: Rapid City, SD

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Using the CIS programming languages and leveraging fellow IT CIS developers as needed, perform assigned software development and maintenance tasks including development of specifications, programming and testing.
  • Develop scripts as needed for batch processing and with the guidance of fellow developers as needed. Set scripts up in UC4 or Report Services for run scheduling.
  • Develop relationships with end users to effectively troubleshoot problems and recommend solutions.
  • Provide follow-up to ensure successful implementations.
  • Support CIS processing by being the on-call person for a week at a time supporting online and batch processing in the event issues arise. Higher level IT CIS Developers will assist when needed.
  • Troubleshoot user CIS application issues and devise or modify programs to solve problems.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensure compliance with technical best practices, policies, standards, and software licensing.
  • Accountable for change management and SOX compliance.
  • Track, monitor, and report progress of assignments.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Software Developer Analyst I:

  • Associate degree and/or equivalent experience required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in an Information Technology field preferred.
  • Programming experience at a company and/or programming experience obtained at college in your pursuit of an Associate or Bachelor’s degree.
  • Experience with job scheduling software is helpful.
  • Natural programming language is extremely beneficial.

Software Developer Analyst II:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field or equivalent combination of education and experience required.
  • Five (5) plus years of related IT developer experience. Supporting a customer based application is very positive.
  • Natural, language experience is extremely positive. Cobol or Easytrieve programming experience are helpful.
  • UC4, Report Services, and EntireX experience is a plus.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:

  • Ability to work independently with business partners in software requirements and system support while keeping team members well informed of efforts.
  • Ability to write accurate and efficient SQL statements.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Good customer service skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and work within challenging situations.
  • Ability to respond quickly to changing priorities.
  • Self-starter with excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks.
  • Ability to demonstrate good troubleshooting skills.
  • Capacity to work well independently as well as in a team.

MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS:

The mental and physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Mental Requirements: Ability to understand, remember, apply oral and/or written instructions or other information, and communicate routine factual information. Ability to apply common sense in performing job functions, usually within a set of rules or guidelines.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is continuously (67% or more) required to: use fingers and hands, communicate, and have close visual acuity. Employee is frequently (34-66%) required to: reach, push/pull, ascend/descend stairs, position self to access lower items, and move about the office. Employee must be able to operate routine office equipment including computers and similar equipment. Must be able to routinely perform this work for an average of 6-8 hours per day and occasional extended hours as necessary. Must be capable of regular, reliable, and timely attendance.

Specific lifting abilities required by this job include: Sedentary work. Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force frequently or continuously to lift, carry, push, pull or sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met.

Work environment: Must be able to routinely perform work indoors in climate-controlled shared work area with moderate noise level. Must be capable of occasional travel (less than 10 days per year) by automobile (as driver and passenger), commercial airlines, rental vehicles and public transportation and be able to lodge in public facilities.

Candidates must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check.
