About OpenMarket

We’ve got a pretty good thing going on here at OpenMarket. We’re leaders of a mobile industry that's transforming the way customer obsessed businesses communicate with their customers. Join our team: we're friendly, caring, weirdly tenacious, and fun.

The world’s biggest brands seek us out because we love finding ways to help them make their customers’ lives easier. It’s this obsession with customer experience that helps us develop software, technology and processes that competitors all over the world desire.

OpenMarket Culture

We’re seeking enthusiastic, collaborative and resourceful people from a range of backgrounds who know how to get things done. Success comes from our culture, diversity and dynamic global team so we value people who are authentic, take ownership, and deliver together. Does this sound like you?

Software Development Engineer in Test

Do you enjoy breaking software? Are you passionate about providing a good customer experience? OpenMarket is currently seeking test-focused software development engineers to work with developers and program managers to write test cases based on specifications and user stories. You will analyze requirements and use cases, create and execute test plans, and discover and document defects. Using your Java skills, you will automate functional, non-functional, unit, and integration testing of application software. Working on a small, dedicated service team, you will ensure your services are able to scale while maintaining HA in a 99.99% up-time environment.

What to bring

  • Creative and analytical problem-solving skills
  • A collaborative working style-communicate and work well in our team environment
  • Java generalist with deep experience writing test-focused code
  • Experience with high-level software design
  • Requirements/use case analysis, strong test case development and execution, and defect recording and tracking
  • Focus on continuous improvement of all processes
  • Familiar with HTTP, JSON (or XML), and REST (or SOAP) and knowledge of networking technologies/tools
  • Experience with web server technologies such as Tomcat or Jetty
  • Experience with an assortment of test automation frameworks such as RESTAssured and JUnit
  • Experience with Linux/Unix
  • Proven understanding of testing methodologies and SDLC

Nice to have

  • Experience with Agile software development methodologies
  • Experience with databases such as MySQL or Oracle
  • Experience with programming and/or scripting with bash shell scripting, HTML
  • Experience with browser automation and UI automation

We’d love to hear from you if

  • You love being a part of a small, dynamic, and agile team that encourages you to learn and grow
  • You desire to work with some of the world’s top brands
  • You love finding solutions to interesting problems and figuring out how things work
  • You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks
  • You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team

Education/Training Required

  • A Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent experience
Additional Information

This position is open in Seattle, WA.
OpenMarket embraces diversity and is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer.
We are unable to sponsor new U.S. work visas at this time.
Employment in this position may be contingent upon successful completion of a criminal and/or credit background investigation.

Job Description

Allstate’s strategy continues to put a growing focus on data and technology as we continue our digital transformation journey. This has created numerous opportunities in the technology organization to find work that is meaningful to you. We’re building innovative products here, in our own labs.

The Content Management & Search (CMS) team is responsible for supporting multiple platforms: web content management, digitial asset management, and search. CMS team members partner with a diverse group of clients – ranging from teams that support Allstate.com to teams that support customer information across all channels. The Search Technologies Developer - Solr plays a critical role in the solution lifecycle including: responding to feature and configuration requests, designing solutions, envisioning follow up work, and taking ownership of operational excellence of the Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities

The Search Application Developer core responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Implementation and support of Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr solutions.
  • Document detailed design, functional and technical specifications in developing Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr solutions.
  • Exhibit expertise in Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr architecture and the demonstrated competency to design, deploy and support solutions in a shared services architecture.
  • Develop, execute, and document procedures and standards adhering to SDLC best practices including the Agile Scrum methodology.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues, perform root cause analysis and take appropriate action to remediate issues.
  • Participates in the discovery phase of projects to determine high level design.
  • Analyzes business needs and develops plans to implement software requirements in conjunction with product management and architects.
  • Independently handles high impact, critical software/systems monitoring issues and tickets/ incidents.
  • Troubleshoots business and production issues.
  • Mentors and coaches junior developers in Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr solutions.
  • Collaborates with other technologists as a member of a broad, cross-functional team motivated to solve business problems.
Job Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience with Lucidworks Fusion and/or open source search engines Apache Solr, Lucene, or Elasticsearch.
  • Experience with building scalable, high performing and robust Java and/or .NET applications.
  • Advanced scripting skills in at least one of the following: Puppet, Perl, Python, Bash, or Unix Shell and willingness to learn new technologies.
  • Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g., GitHub).
  • Self-motivated, industrious person able to operate effectively and independently in a collaborative, fluid IT and business environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or experience in closely related field
Preferred Competencies
  • Experience developing with Apache Solr
  • Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (e.g., Jenkins, Artifactory Pro, SonarQube, Selenium, Jmeter, and so forth).
  • Experience with some or all of Apache, JBoss / Tomcat, or other application servers.
  • Experience with Node JS, AngularJS, Bootstrap or other web-based frameworks.
  • Exposure to Spark


The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Job Description

CapTech’s Customer Experience (CX) team seeks a UX Architect with a passion for user experience and who is always ahead of the curve with new thinking and techniques. As a UX Architect, you will be responsible for creating compelling, user-vetted, and innovative experiences across a wide variety of channels and devices. While it’s not required you be expert in every field, you should have a working knowledge of content and digital strategy.

This could be the opportunity for you if:

  • You have strong knowledge of information architecture, interaction design, user centered design, user research methodologies, and accessibility best practices.
  • You have expert knowledge of user interface best practices and standards and support your recommendations with user and market research activities and findings.
  • You are an excellent collaborator and enjoy working with other designers and developers to create award winning experiences.
  • You are an active learner, strategic thinker, self-motivated and have experience within a digital company.
  • You have a proven ability to work well on simultaneous projects within tight deadlines.
  • Able to create useable, intuitive, and innovative experiences, communicating your rationale to team members and clients.
  • You understand relevant marketplace and consumer and technology factors and can contribute at a high-level to the strategic approach of our clients.
  • You can demonstrate developed UX solutions for a wide variety of platforms and devices.
  • You consistently review the standard of work, ensuring that only work meeting the highest levels of quality are presented to the client.

Responsibilities may include:

  • Involvement in and leading design activities on multiple projects, from market research to concept development, as a strong advocate for the end user
  • Assisting team in a successful and on-time project delivery
  • Presenting and articulating creative solutions to internal teams with confidence
  • Planning and polishing project deliverables created by UX team
  • Providing research oversight and direction for UX Analysts and Interaction Designers prior to review with Creative Director/UX Director and/or clients.
  • Managing project thread and overseeing small project teams
  • Leading brainstorming and research planning sessions
  • Collaborating on project estimation and planning
  • Leading advanced activities such as design workshops, rapid prototyping, and iterative user testing

Qualifications

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Proven written, verbal, conceptual and visual communication skills
  • High-level understanding of technologies with the ability to weave that understanding together to make informed decisions
  • Ability to create and present to internal teams and clients clean, detailed, deliverables with high production value. E.g., journey maps, flows
  • Expert understanding of usability principles and user research methodologies
  • Expert level of proficiency in tools such as Axure, InVision, Sketch, Omnigraffle, Optimal Workshop, and Survey Monkey.
  • 5+ years professional experience
  • 4-year+ degree, BA or BS in design, information sciences, HCI, or psychology
  • Working knowledge of common software project management and development practices is a plus.

Please include a link to your online portfolio with your application in order to be considered. Strong preference for examples indicating your process.

We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands-on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.

We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace.

At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Job Summary

**In addition to Irving, TX, we are open to candidates to work from our offices in the following markets: Charlotte, NC; Tempe, AZ; & Chicago, IL**

Allstate Technology & Strategic Ventures (ATSV) team is embarking on a journey to integrate security inside the software development lifecycle. Application Security is tasked to develop a security framework within the Allstate SDLCs, establish a software security assurance process, and work with product delivery teams to build applications securely from start to finish.

The Application Security Engineer will be responsible for integrating security into the development of Allstate’s applications. The Application Security Engineer will work closely with the product and software development team to threat model, vulnerability scan, and pen test the early software, system, and network architecture and identify required control points in the application stack. The Application Security Engineer will also work closely with developers to diagnose, document, and remediate application security vulnerabilities. The Application Security Engineer will also be responsible for evaluating, recommending, and implementing application security related software in an automated continuous integration/deployment environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work closely with application development and platform teams to help formulate and implement a strategy for software security that is tailored to the specific risks facing the organization, including threat modeling and applications security advisement services.
  • Develop and maintain a balanced application security program based on a well-defined application security framework.
  • Conduct application security assessments / penetration tests and implement tools for dynamic/automated code reviews.
  • Ensure application design and implementation best-practice with role-based and appropriate access standards, as well as integration with Identity and Access Management environments.
  • Ensure compliance with society, regulatory, and industry standards for application security.
  • Continuously evaluate the organization’s existing application security practices, define and measure security-related activities, and demonstrating concrete improvements to the application assurance program within the organization.
  • Provide secure application development training to developers and provide guidance on the development of web-based training for ongoing awareness.
  • Conduct code reviews and penetration testing.
  • Develop and maintain unit and integration tests designed to ensure security controls are tested on every build.

Job Qualifications

The ideal candidate would be 50% programmer and 50% hacker. Examples of qualifications that resemble this profile are as follows:

  • 3-5 years’ experience in a software development field such as Software Developer, Architect, Software Quality Assurance, or Application Security Engineer
  • Highly proficient in at least one of the following development languages: Java, .NET, Node.js, or Python
  • Strong understanding of application architectural patterns, such as MVC, Microservices, Event-driven etc.
  • Creative, organized, responsive, and highly thorough problem solver
  • Strong business acumen with ability to work with application development, QA and security teams
  • Possess a restlessness or desire to break into things
  • Knowledge of the OWASP Top 10
  • Strong self-starter who has the ability to operate independently
  • Solid understanding and experience with establishing software development policies across an organization
  • Excellent oral/written presentation skills with ability to communicate effectively with senior executive leadership; proficiency in preparation of presentations, analytical reports, and documents regarding program operational status, achievement and performance
  • Understanding and Passion for Agile/XP/Scrum/Kanban
  • Understanding of Test Driven Development built on User Stories
  • Understanding of Continuous Integration/Testing/Delivery
  • Solid Container DevOps experience
  • Familiarity with Metasploit, Burp Suite, Fuzzing, Gaunlt, and Jenkins preferred
  • Familiarity with code reviews and penetration testing preferred
  • PCF exposure preferred
  • College degree with advanced degree preferred
  • OSCP, OSCE, or OSWE Certifications are a major plus


The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Job Description

Front End Solutions Developers at CapTech are part of an intelligent, highly motivated community of developers who strive to continuously learn the latest tools and architectures to deliver innovative solutions for our clients. They are involved in the design, development and delivery of innovative web solutions in partnership with a variety of Fortune 500 clients. CapTech’s developers enjoy a highly collaborative environment and have many opportunities to learn from and share knowledge with other CapTech developers, architects, and our clients.

Specific responsibilities for the Front End Solutions Developer position include:

  • Understand the challenges being addressed by an engagement and collaborate with team members, clients, and stakeholders to deliver a technical solution that meet the unique needs of our clients.
  • Help our clients maximize the value of their web presence by building accessible, high-performance web applications using the latest web standards.
  • Create quality deliverables to communicate technical solutions to appropriate audiences.
  • Design, develop, unit test, and deploy web based solutions using common standards and frameworks.
  • Leverage CapTech’s internal programs and self-directed training to continually develop industry relevant knowledge and skills.
  • Provide technical mentoring and leadership to more junior resources.

Qualifications

Specific qualifications for this Front-End Engineer position include:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Demonstrated progression in standards-compliant web development (semantic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript).
  • Understanding of performance testing and optimization techniques.
  • Ability to present technical ideas, high-level concepts, and solutions to internal and external team members with varying degrees of technical knowledge.
  • Ability to implement responsive designs and understand device-agnostic development techniques.
  • 5+ years experience with JavaScript libraries and frameworks (Angular, React, and Vue) preferred.
  • Experience developing modern session data management strategies (ngrx, Redux, and MobX).
  • Familiarity with CSS pre-processors (SASS/SCSS, Less, and Stylus).
  • Understanding of modern front-end engineering best practices (accessibility, 508/WCAG compliance, performance optimization, etc.).
  • Experience integrating with modern, industry-leading web content management platforms.
  • High proficiency with development tools and workflows (modern source control systems, unit testing, continuous workflow, etc.).

Additional Information

We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands-on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.

At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:

  • Competitive salary with performance-based bonus opportunities
  • Single and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverage
  • Short-Term and Long-Term disability
  • Matching 401(k)
  • Competitive Paid Time Off
  • Training and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursement
  • Team building and social activities
  • Mentor program to help you develop your career

CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace.

Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or “corp to corp” agreements). At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.


CapTech is a Drug-Free work place.
Candidates must have the ability to work at CapTech’s client locations.
All positions include the possibility of travel.
CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.

Where good people build rewarding careers.

Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Position Summary

Mid-level technical position in the Analytics Solutions Group (ASG) responsible for development of IIoT software applications while working in the project team. This opportunity would have a career path focus identified between development and database. This role could be assigned leadership of a small team of lower level developers to support in mentoring as well as support the project technical lead in planning and executing of daily activities.

Technical Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrates a solid knowledge and experience of software development techniques and principles. Demonstrates ability to meet project budgets and scope.
  • Demonstrates technical and functional experience in using and developing an “enterprise-wide” business application on a platform like MES, ERP, etc. (i.e. SAP, FactoryTalk Production Centre, PTC ThingWorx, Vuforia, Kepware etc.)
  • Demonstrates knowledge and consistent performance in conversion of software design to effective implementation in commercial software products including following Rockwell Automation iPM (Project Management Model).
  • Demonstrates leadership through ownership of technical project deliverables and working with less experienced resources for assigned project work scopes.
  • Performs and or directs the technical work scope for projects, and provides accurate status reporting of same to technical leadership and project management.
  • Responsible for maintaining and enhancing personal technical skills as well as working with less experienced team members.
  • Domain experience working with manufacturing execution (MES), manufacturing operations management (MOM), SCADA, or material resource/enterprises resource planning (MRP/ERP) systems or applications is preferred.
  • Knowledge of pertinent industry concepts and standards as they pertain to MES (i.e. MESA, ISA 95, etc.)
  • Development Technical Knowledge:
  • Working on development teams using a technology stack like .NET, J2EE, web services, ASP, etc.
  • Experience with an integrated development environment either for .NET or Java.
  • Executes functional test plans, unit testing, and supports customer facing user acceptance testing
  • Database Technical Knowledge
  • Designing and interfacing information systems to the factory automation layer through data historians, OPC servers, or other mechanisms.
  • Write and perform queries efficiently, use and understand different data access technologies, understand the uses and limitations of each data type, understand XML datatypes and their schemas.
  • Write stored procedures to meet a given set of requirements, manage branching logic, understand deterministic and non-deterministic functions.
  • Understand statistics, read query plans, mark a transaction, evaluate the use of row-based operations vs. set-based operations, transaction management.
  • Troubleshoots and optimizes (understand statistics, read query plans, mark a transaction, evaluate the use of row-based operations vs. set-based operations, transaction management).

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Legal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Requires a minimum of 8 years related experience in software project delivery in manufacturing environments
  • Experience with VMWare environments, Networking, operating systems, and the design and configuration of Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Analytics, ProductionCentre Application Suites (CPG Suite or PharmaSuite), PTC ThingWorx, Vuforia & Kepware.
  • Experience with Software design methodologies
  • Willing and able to travel and work at customer sites. Travel can vary on assignment from 0% to 100% but can average 30%

Position/Title: Senior Solutions Architect (Microsoft)


** Will be supporting our new Machine Learning/AI practice. **


Location: Nashville, TN


Primary Purpose:

Utilize knowledge of systems hardware and software to create custom solutions. Work closely with business analysts, customers, developers and programmers and guide high-level decisions throughout the design process.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

  • Work with Business Analysts to gather functional requirements at a system level
  • Work with Business Analysts to determine project scope at a system level
  • Design and implement hardware systems and software applications
  • Develop architectural solutions for systems, databases, user interfaces, and web services
  • Conceptualize software systems to address particular needs for end-users
  • Pitch project proposals to departments, management, or clients
  • Provide training about new programs to end-users
  • Collaborate with programmers and developers to determine project scope and direction
  • Decide on the platforms and coding standards to be used in project development
  • Evaluate existing software solutions to identify areas for improvement
  • Create modifications for existing software to upgrade performance
  • Conduct testing to ensure optimal functionality
  • Debug any errors or issues that arise
  • Ensure architectural integrity of software solutions
  • Determine project timelines and complete work to deadlines
  • Assign tasks to members of the development team
  • Conduct cost analysis to ensure projects remain within budget
  • Maintain thorough documentation of systems and applications
  • Mentor, encourage, and motivate team members
  • Oversee architectural approaches from conception to installation
  • Document architectural solutions

Minimum Skills and Competencies:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experience
  • 10+ years of experience in a software architect role supporting Microsoft development projects (.Net, C#, ASP.Net)
  • Professional certification in software architecture, frameworks, or languages (Angular, Bootstrap, REACT)
  • Strong project management skills
  • Able to lead a team effectively
  • Superior interpersonal communication skills
  • Clear and coherent written communication, including visual representations of data
  • Knowledge of Waterfall and Agile development methodologies
  • Extensive understanding of architectural styles and design patterns
  • Familiarity with several coding and computer languages
  • Experience with database design and data modeling
  • Background in service oriented architecture (SOA)
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)

Desired Skills:

  • Bachelor Degree in computer science, software engineering or a related field
  • Previous experience within the Insurance Industry

Who We Are

First thing you need to know; Bestow is not your typical insurance company. We’ve completely reimagined industry assumptions, and harnessed technology and big data to create life insurance products that aren’t just delightful to use but deliver on our mission: to make financial products accessible to more people than ever before.

Check us out at hellobestow.com

Who We’re Looking For

“Innovative” and “disruptive” can be overused words. But at Bestow, it isn’t jargon, it’s an everyday rally cry. We are rewriting the rules of the 400-year-old, $7 trillion life insurance industry, serving communities who have been underserved in the past, and we believe the future is a bright one.

So, if you’re excited by the idea of being a part of a well funded startup, working at a mission-driven company and fundamentally shaking up an age-old industry, please read on.

Our ideal Product Designer is a relentless problem-solver who has a passion for innovation, is obsessed with understanding people and what motivates them, and always strives to create compelling digital product experiences.

We want a self-motivated, multi-talented, passionate design thinker to join our creative team. Ultimately, cultural fit and creative problem solving are extremely important. We are looking for a team player who will approach this role with creativity, humility, and empathy.

What You'll Do

  • Advocate a human-centered design approach in every aspect of user experience on all our products.
  • Transition high-fidelity screen designs into an animation or prototyping tool to test features with users and developers.
  • Create schematics, wireframes, and design documentation needed for new product features.
  • User testing and user research.
  • Confidently communicate and present design concepts, design rationale and the specifics of proposed solutions.
  • Develop and maintain our design system.
  • Be a trusted design partner amongst bright peers of product managers and engineers who will look to you to guide them in creating harmonious user experiences and design.

What You'll Need

  • 1-4 years of industry experience in digital product design or a degree in HCD (human-centered design) or user experience design.
  • Ability to design projects across the entire product lifecycle and multiple product launches.
  • Ability to define problems & goals, map user flows, prototype interactions, and oversee the building process across different client platforms.
  • A deep understanding of customer problems to create elegant but practical solutions.
  • Thorough knowledge and experience across a range of design approaches, methodologies, and lo-fi & high-fi prototyping skills.
  • Proficiency in prototyping and design software including Sketch, inVision, and Adobe CC tools.
  • Initiative to identify problems and act on opportunities to improve the product offering.
  • Strong visual and interaction design abilities with experience designing for responsive web and native mobile experience.
  • Strong written & verbal communication and presentation skills.
  • Strong collaboration skills across disciplines to drive change into products.
  • Ability to manage and work on multiple projects concurrently.
  • Deep empathy for customers and processes for gaining it.
  • Bonus Points: Experience with design research and a working knowledge of front-end development.

What We Can Offer To You

  • Competitive salary
  • Generous PTO
  • Flexible schedule and work/life balance
  • 100% company-paid health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Choose your own computer setup (Mac or PC)
  • Office snacks and weekly team lunches
  • Team building events and activities
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Bestow does not currently sponsor applicants for work visas.

    The STAR Program Office is building their PeopleSoft Development team! We are seeking detailed, enthusiastic, and motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment! Recent graduates to seasoned ERP professionals are encouraged to apply. A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential.

    The State Transforming Agency Resources Program Office (STAR) is an efficient and reliable enterprise-wide system designed to provide better consistency among state agencies as well as a modernization of the State's IT infrastructure. STAR maintains the state's finance, budget, procurement, business intelligence and human resource functions. Click here to learn more about STAR!

    STAR has multiple positions available at each level of expertise to build their Development team that will support the State of Wisconsin Enterprise.

    Click THIS VIDEO to learn more about working for Wisconsin!

    For more information about the selection process, see our General Information Page.


    Position Summary:
    The Entry Level PeopleSoft Developer (Professional) is focused on learning the Oracle PeopleSoft Applications and toolsets. Oracle PeopleSoft’s PeopleTools is a comprehensive development toolset that supports the development and runtime of PeopleSoft application. This position will be heavily involved with the documentation process.
    Key Responsibilities include:
  • Assist in major system initiatives and provide installation, maintenance, and customer support for State of Wisconsin’s enterprise technology environment.

    • Click here for the full position description.

    The PeopleSoft Developer (Senior) focuses on assisting senior staff on technical installation and maintenance support for PeopleSoft applications and associated hardware, software, and services.
    Key Responsibilities include:
  • Product development and implementation to ensure the timely delivery of application changes.
  • Support for enhancements and ongoing maintenance of applications.

    • Click here for the full position description.

    The Advanced PeopleSoft Developer (Specialist) manages activities for and performs complex product development and maintenance for State of Wisconsin’s enterprise technology environment.
    Key responsibilities include:
  • Support agencies/divisions through the application development process including the definition and design of specifications for the interfaces, data conversions, reports, etc.
  • Ensure the Application Integration & Development process is managed properly to achieve the overall business goals.

    • Click here for the full position description.

    The Development Section Lead (Consultant Administrator) is the technical authority of the applications services for the enterprise technology environment. This technical leader is responsible for working with members of the STAR Program Office, State Agencies and DOA Division customers to provide solutions.
    Key responsibilities include:
  • Leads complex systems projects to successful completion using mastery knowledge of PeopleSoft technology suite.
  • Function as the technical authority for PeopleSoft and it’s developmental initiatives;

    • Click here for the full position description.

All persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States, and to complete the required employment eligibility form.

    • Software development experience with development tools such as but not limited to: PeopleCode, Ruby, Python,, C#, C++, COBOL, App Designer, etc
    • Production support experience

    • Enterprise Resource planning (ERP) module experience
    • Working with vendors on bug resolution

    • Code review or technical walk through experience
    • Experience mentoring or training others

      • Development Section Lead

    • Peoplesoft Development experience (any PeopleTools, App Designer, PeopleCode, BI Publisher)
    • PeopleSoft application experience
    • Project leadership experience

      • In addition to the minimal qualifications, well qualified applicants for Development Section Lead will have:
    • Experience mentoring or training others

The Software Development Engineer will be a part of a fast-paced engineering team responsible for the implementation of platform services in our data integration portfolio.

You will work collaboratively with a cross-functional agile team to design platform APIs and microservices for new or enhanced features and implementing those features iteratively. You will utilize development best practices and contribute to build and test automation as well as final deployment to ensure delivery of a high-quality offering. We are looking for motivated team players ready to improve their craft and learn new skills building modern apps in the cloud and beyond.

A strong academic background is key to success with solid coding foundation, a strong desire to learn new and better ways to write software, and good communication skills.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Solve complex data problems using distributed micro-service architectures deployed in hybrid environments
  • Leverage, promote and maintain high standards in design patterns and reuse in our code base
  • Effectively perform requirements analysis, design, implementation, and validation as part of overall development process.
  • Effectively evaluate and troubleshoot complex product issues to identify root cause(s) and resolve without detrimental side effects.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Accredited university degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience
  • 1-3 years experience writing service-oriented Java applications leveraging Spring
  • Experience working with Docker and/or Kubernetes
  • Experience with API design and consumption
  • Understanding of security best practices such as OWASP Top 10
  • Understanding of design patterns, abstraction layers, and code quality, and quality engineering practices
  • Understanding of continuous integration and delivery patterns

Local candidates only. This position isn't eligible for relocation assistance. The company doesn't sponsor applicants for work visas.

Primary Purpose:

Assist and participate in project reviews, revisions, production problem corrections, enhancements, and usability testing of any functionality required to administer policy sales and servicing in the NPS and ANA operating systems. Assist as a liaison between developer and end-users, provide technical support to successfully implement system changes to the comprehensive policy and agency management system to comply with filed programs for multiple states, companies, products and lines of business. Increase business and system knowledge.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

  • Prepare test plans and scenarios for usability testing, execute test scenarios, approve project implementation and verify the production output upon implementation
  • Responsible for verifying the accuracy of new states/ products, rate revisions, projects, and production problem corrections, to ensure a quality product
  • Formulate the test strategy for testing through analysis of system requirements which includes participating in meetings to discuss specifications
  • Assist in project planning, incorporating system considerations for various operational areas, and submit the request for programming changes
  • With supervision, coordinate and document the resolution of problems encountered during and subsequent to the usability testing
  • Assist in performing quality control procedures in the production environment
  • Perform other duties as requested

Minimum Skills and Competencies:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experience
  • Strong attention to detail, organization skills, and timeliness in order to meet customer expectations
  • Demonstrates strong problem solving skills
  • Demonstrates effective listening, communicate, interaction, discretion, and diplomacy skills
  • Must possess effective verbal and written communication skills to interact with business and technical resources
  • Must perform well in high-energy, dynamic and team-oriented environment
  • Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to aggressive project deadlines
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish working relationships with individuals at varying levels within the organization
  • Demonstrates a general understanding of the insurance industry and organizational relationships of the company

Desired Skills:

  • Previous Property and Casualty Insurance experience strongly preferred
  • Prior project management experience preferred
  • Demonstrates the ability to understand and translate user needs into business specifications
  • Demonstrates working knowledge of company operating systems and processes including a working knowledge of the policy administration system
  • Demonstrates the ability to conduct investigation and research into system errors and discrepancies
  • Demonstrates skill in the development of test plans and test cases through thorough analysis of requirements

National General Holdings Corp. is headquartered in New York City. National General traces its roots to 1939, has a financial strength rating of A– (excellent) from A.M. Best, and provides personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, motorcycle, supplemental health, and other niche insurance products. We are a specialty personal lines insurance holding company. Through our subsidiaries, we provide a variety of insurance products, including personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, supplemental health, lender-placed and other niche insurance products.

National General is a fast paced, dynamic, and entrepreneurial organization. Our team members live by and exemplify what we call the 4Es. At National General, we are Energized, Engaged, Empowered, and we Execute every day in order to provide an exceptional experience for our customers! We are passionate about our organization and the value that we add every day. A successful candidate with National General will embody the 4Es. Our team is poised to outperform the competition. We are National General Insurance and with us you can be extraordinary! Come join our team!

Direct General Auto & Life, Personal Express Insurance, Century-National Insurance, ABC Insurance Agencies, NatGen Preferred, NatGen Premier, Seattle Specialty, National General Lender Services, ARS, RAC Insurance Partners, Mountain Valley Indemnity, New Jersey Skylands, Adirondack Insurance Exchange, VelaPoint, Quotit, HealthCompare, AHCP, NHIC, Healthcare Solutions Team, North Star Marketing, Euro Accident.

Job Summary

We currently have an opportunity for a Spring 2020 Co-op to join the Software Engineering team in our R&D department, participating in software application development and verification activities for data management web applications for our apheresis medical devices.

This position is located at our Lake Zurich, IL Corporate headquarters.

Responsibilities

  • Implementation, test, and maintenance of new and existing data management products.
  • Formally verify software components satisfy their requirements and designs.
  • Make detailed observations, analyze data and interpret results.
  • Operates within defined processes and procedures consistent with a regulated environment.
  • Generate clear and detailed documentation.
  • Collaborate across functions to achieve objectives.

Requirements:

  • Minimum two years of undergraduate classwork in computer science, computer engineering, or related discipline. GPA of 3.0 or higher.
  • Available to work 3 alternating semesters or quarters, including summers, as a co-op.
  • Demonstrable understanding of the software development life-cycle and software development methodologies.
  • Knowledge in creating, executing, and reporting on testcases derived from system requirements.
  • Knowledge in test automation process, tools, and methodologies.
  • Experience with software configuration management and configuration control. Experience with Git preferred.
  • Experience with HTTP, SOAP, and REST protocols is desired.
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL server databases is desired.
  • Excellent organizational, analytical, troubleshooting, and debugging skills.
  • Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States; the Company will not sponsor work visas or other employment authorization.

Additional Information

We offer an excellent salary and benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as life insurance, disability, 401K with company match, and wellness program.

Job Family Summary
The FLIGHT Test Engineer family is an active and integral participant on software development teams. The FLIGHT Test Engineer supports all test strategy and coordination, planning, creation and execution activities for multiple test types identified as in-scope, champions overall quality efforts, identifies and defines acceptance criteria and test conditions, and creates and executes test scenarios that validate application acceptance criteria.
Job Description
The FLIGHT Performance Test Engineer Consultant I owns all test coordination, planning, and creation or execution of performance test scripts for low to medium complexity projects. This engineer coordinates and owns the test strategy as the overall performance test champion on the team, identifies acceptance criteria, defines the test conditions when stories or requirements are created, designs and implements test performance architecture and may enhance and modify the test performance framework. The Test Engineer would also participate and own performance test planning and execution activities.
Key Responsibilities
  • Decompose and/or solicit business requirements to be able to write effective acceptance criteria and develop automated test scripts for basic/low complexity projects.
  • Test a range of Products spanning Legacy Apps, Web Sites/Portals, Mobile Apps, and Web Services.
  • Develop automated scripts that support existing Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery pipeline.
  • Identify and communicate testing-related Defects/Issues/Risks.
  • Possess technical competency to interact with application developers to ensure software quality. This may include architectural reviews, design sessions, and code reviews.
  • Possess thorough understanding of environment and infrastructure that the Products will be deployed to.
  • Apply Testing Lifecycle Management principles in the context of a product/project.
  • Create, consult and maintain an environment where a Test Driven Development behavior is fostered
  • In an agile/scrum environment, may:
  • Execute practical application of Agile framework components (user stories, scrum, sprints, etc.).
  • Participate in Scrum, Daily Stand-up, Sprint and iterative development activities
  • Participate in Sprint planning and backlog refinement
  • Define acceptance criteria when stories are created
  • 3+ years’ hands on automation/testing engineer role in Selenium with Java/C# language
  • Experience constructing test plans and executing against these plans across functional, regression unit, system, performance, stress and load testing
Key Responsibilities (Cont'd)
  • 2+ years’ of hands on experience with the following tools:
  • Agile Planning tool (e.g. JIRA)
  • Functional Test Automation (e.g. Selenium WebDriver, UFT)
  • Defect Management (e.g. HP Quality Center)
  • Source Code Management Tools (e.g. Git, TFS, RTC)
Job Qualifications
  • Experience with performance testing tools such as Jmeter or Performance test center is highly desired.
  • Experience in modifying/maintaining Selenium automation frameworks will be a huge plus.
  • Relational Database Management (e.g. Oracle, SQL, MySQL)
  • Continuous Integration tools (e.g. Jenkins, Octopus, Hudson) Experience in architecting, implementing solutions/frameworks to effectively transition testing to the cloud is a huge plus.
  • Security testing experience [Application Layer] is a huge plus

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

listings.position: Senior Programmer/Developer - Data Integration Architect - Informatica
listings.description:
Senior ETL Architect with 10+ years of system development lifecycle experience, a minimum 2 years of experience in Data Integration Projects using Informatica.
Should have experience in soup to nuts of technology including Requirements, SDLC and Maintenance.
Have hands on experience in Data Governance, Metadata Management, Reference Data Management and Business Glossary Management initiatives
Experience in Data modelling, preferable knowledge with Erwin, ER Studio
Should have experience with Informatica Power Exchange to SAP and other ERP systems
Knowledge of SAPECC IDocs and BAPI/RFC/R3 functionality is mandatory
Should have experience in API development, including best practices, testing methods and deployment strategies.
Designing, creating, refining, deploying and managing the organization's data architecture including the end-to-end vision for how data will flow from system to system, for multiple applications and across different territory.
Should be well versed with the tools like SOA, ETL, ERP, XML etc
Should have understanding of Python, Cloud and Relational Databases
Good knowledge in Python, UNIX Shell scripts and should be able to write/debug Python & Shell Scripts
Working well within an agile team environment and applying the related working methods.
Able to analyze and understand complex customer scenario's and thrives on difficult challenges
Team player, multitasker, excellent communication skills (convey highly technical information into business terms, clear email communications), ability to mentor team members

Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment.
Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini.

Qualifications

Responsible for programming and software development using various programming languages and related tools and frameworks, reviewing code written by other programmers, requirement gathering, bug fixing, testing, documenting and implementing software systems. Experienced programmers are also responsible for interpreting architecture and design, code reviews, mentoring, guiding and monitoring programmers, ensuring adherence to programming and documentation policies, software development, testing and release.

Required Skills and Experience:

You assign, coordinate, and review work and activities of programming personnel. Collaborate with computer manufacturers and other users to develop new programming methods. Supervise, train, mentor junior level programmers in programming and program coding. Represent team in project meetings. Work with business and functional analysts, and software & solution architects in ensuring that programs and systems function as intended Supervise, mentor and manage large teams of programmers in one or more projects. Represent project teams in project/program meetings or in meetings with sponsor.
  • Qualifications: 6-8 years (2 years min relevant experience in the role)experience, Bachelor’s Degree.
  • Must have experience in Software Engineering Techniques, Software Engineering Architecture, Software Engineering Lifecycle and Data Management.
  • Should be proficient in Business Analysis, Business Knowledge, Software Engineering Leadership, Architecture Knowledge and Technical Solution Design.

About Capgemini


A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.

About IDS
IDS is a world-class software developer of enterprise level software for the commercial finance industry. Headquartered in Minneapolis with global offices in Australia, Europe and India, International Decision Systems, Inc. has a 40-year history of serving the majority of the top 200 leasing organizations worldwide. IDS’ customers are among the largest publicly traded organizations in the world and they value IDS for its nimble, responsive technology expertise. At IDS, you’ll be part of an innovative team of professionals who serve the world’s commercial finance industry with progressive products and financial depth only available from an integrated strategic partner.

About the Position
The Senior Business Application Consultant (SBAC) works on for-fee product implementation, enhancement, integration, conversion, business process enhancement and training projects. They also participate in all phases of software implementation; requirements gathering, solution design, development, testing, launch, and post go-live support. Conduct business analysis to gather internal process and issues faced by the customer base to help formulate recommendations for improvement and ensure successful implementation of the IDS solution. In addition, you will perform technical implementation tasks, primarily via software configuration, to deliver solutions that align with the overall solution design. The SBAC also works with the customer to resolve conflicts between business requirements and system capabilities.

Responsibilities and Deliverables:
  • Defines concepts independently with users and under direction of project managers to ensure timely completion of milestone dependencies
  • Communicates proactively and collaborates with customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements to successfully deliver the following specifications: Solution Design Document, Consumer Interaction Flow, Use Cases, and Interface Designs/Flows
  • Consults with SME as needed to maximize implementation of the solution
  • Evaluates information gathered from multiple sources and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
  • Develops requirements specifications per standard templates, using natural language and identify common features for inclusion in our Platform
  • Assists the technical consulting team with translation of business requirements into detailed technical designs
  • Testing and signing-off on product customizations/technical integrations during development and test phases
  • Participates in project planning and estimating and provide task status/updates to the PM
  • Develops larger, moderately complex projects/assignments independently that have direct impact on department and area results in
Travel Expectations
  • Up to 50% travel
  • Domestic and International travel possible
About You
Required Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience as a consultant in a client facing environment implementing Financial Systems
  • Strong analytical and product management skills, including the ability to interpret customer business needs and translate them into fully specified application and operational requirements
  • Experience implementing originations and asset finance systems (particularly Rapport or InfoLease)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in configuration and workflow management systems and/or xml, xsl, web service development and system integrations
  • Product knowledge of software in the Asset Finance industry
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to a diverse workforce.
IDS does not sponsor employment visa for this role. (i.e. TN, E-3, or H-1B visa status or other).
Candidate must be able to pass criminal and credit background check.

Where good people build rewarding careers.

Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Job Description

Allstate is looking to hire researcher engineers to join our Innovation team at our downtown Chicago and Menlo Park (SF Bay area) locations.


Our team works on a diverse set of data and systems including accident data, location data, computer vision, mobility data, demographics, and deep learning tools to create safety solutions, and cutting-edge risk assessing platforms. This is a great opportunity to work with a talented team of some of the world's leading experts to build solutions that are not only groundbreaking, but also helps make driving safer and save lives.


The Research Engineer will develop novel methods, web service concepts, tools, algorithms and techniques that can leverage both structured and semi-structured data to solve tough problems like mobility analytics, data visualization, accident avoidance and risk prediction for traditional insurance and safety products. He/she will also assist in efforts to evaluate, extract, scrub/prep, analyze and visualize a host of internal and external datasets using machine learning and statistical analysis and communicate to various stakeholders across and outside the company.

Key Responsibilities

  • Implementation of key research findings into working prototypes, and concept demonstrators.
  • Develop solutions, understand the technical problem and solution space, explore analytical and experimentation approach to create solution proof points.
  • Collaborate in a fast-changing environment and to communicate clearly and effectively with colleagues who range from academic researchers, senior data scientists, Developers, Dev Ops, Hardware engineers, and Product managers.
  • Present findings for enterprise specific topics to senior leadership.
  • Prepare and deliver presentations and/or training sessions to share insights from research, software, tools or procedures to internal and external audience on a periodic basis.
  • Develop methods, tools, algorithms, processing approaches for business solutions and product development.
Job Qualifications
  • Master’s in computer science, math, or a highly quantitative discipline.
  • Deep hands on development skills in client/web services and/or cloud computing to support high volume and low latency-sensitive, and secure data.
  • Mastery of one or more of the following languages: Python, Java, C/C++, and agile development methodology and tool suites.
  • Knowledge of advanced data processing/real time systems using tools such as Spark, Flume, Kafka and Akka, and serverless processing architectures..
  • Knowledge in statistical methods and analysis including a deep understanding of regression and classification techniques.
  • 5 to 7 years of experience in research and product development.
  • Proficiency and/or a good understanding of structured and nonstructured databases.
  • Proficiency with data visualization and graphics tools for the creation of professional presentations, reports, web content, or education materials.
  • Genuinely excited and enthusiastic about learning and pushing technical limits when finding new solutions.
  • Ability to create and maintain good working relationships and collaborations while being able to work independently and take initiative.
  • Experience/knowledge in model optimization, evaluation, comparison, validation and selection.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience related to full stack web service development, including web client development is highly desired.
  • Experience in predictive model development, machine learning (MLlib, Mahout) and/or visualization tools of complex data.
  • Experience taking ideas from inception to pre-production products is highly desired.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

listings.description:
Description / Position Overview

If you previously applied for this position (closing date "6/12/19") you do not need to re-apply.

JIS (Justice Information System) JAVA Senior Applications Programmer Analyst

IT (Information Technology) seeks a Senior Applications Programmer Analyst to support the Municipal Court legacy Java application, JIS. The successful candidate will report to the IT department and be required to follow all IT policies and procedures. In this position, you will receive work priorities and requirements from the judicial administrative staff and will work in the Municipal Court building.

Essential Job Functions - the basic job duties an employee must be able to perform:
  • Participate in the design, coordination, and execution of the different phases for the migration of the JIS application/database from the current outdated technologies (software and hardware) in order to modernize, enhance, and secure the application
  • Create design solutions appropriate to the opportunity at hand in terms of simplicity, cost, and supportability, including enhancements based on emerging and changed business requirements to better leverage technology and comply with legislative mandates
  • Mentor other developers in industry best practices related to software application development, programming, and analysis
  • Complete enhancements and fix incidents related to the JIS application written in Java 6 and legacy 3rd party open source technologies, with a SQL (Structured Query Language) Server 2000 database and interface services written in Java
  • Provide day-to-day operational and administrative support for the JIS application
  • Perform data fixes according to pertinent policies and procedures
  • Write SQL queries to perform data adjustments, create and alter data models and procedures to meet ad-hoc reporting and analytical needs
  • Perform unit and system testing; assist with user acceptance testing
  • Develop and promote standard ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) based processes and operating procedures and the propagation and use of the Knowledge Management system following IT policy and processes; document current state architecture, module functionality, and incident or request models
  • Track, document, and manage all customer contact (e.g., calls, e-mails, web forms, chat sessions, and/or voicemails), status, and work performed in the correct ITSM (Information Technology Service Management) tool; ensure timely solution/resolution of all issues and enhancements
Knowledge of:
  • Java 6 to current, JBOSS, Object to Relational Mapping middleware (currently using Hibernate), SQL Server 2000/2016, Windows 2003/2016, T-SQL (Transact-SQL) Programming, Crystal Reports, FTP (File Transfer Protocol), CRON (Command Run On), and Unix/Linux Shell Scripting
  • Systems engineering concepts, modeling techniques and methods, experience in conducting application technology upgrades
  • Business and systems analysis skills, including requirements gathering, development of use cases, transitions to operations, end user documentation, and training
  • Pertinent federal, state, and local government and municipal court laws, codes, and regulations
Ability to:
  • Build collaborative working relationships with customers, service managers, teams, and individuals
  • Show initiative and act independently to resolve problems, manage multiple priorities, and follow through on projects/tasks to completion
  • Demonstrate proper customer collaboration and engagement techniques
  • Manage multiple tasks independently and prioritize to meet business needs
  • Communicate clearly and concisely, orally and in writing, with managers, users and technical support
  • Operate in an ITSM, specifically ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) based, environment
  • Work within ITIL based processes and procedures and promote standard operating procedures to ensure service-level agreements are achieved
This position also requires business and systems analysis skills, including requirements gathering, development of user cases, transitions to operations, and end user documentation and training.

Successful candidate will have:
  • A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in computer science, information management, or a related field
  • Five years of full-time professional experience working in an IT organization in software application development, programming, or analysis
  • Possess, or obtain within six months of hire, ITIL Foundations certification
Ideal candidates will also demonstrate:
  • Developer/programmer experience in Java 6 to current, SQL Server 2000/2016, Windows 2003/2016, T-SQL (Transact-SQL) Programming, DTS/SSIS packages, Crystal Reports, and FTP (File Transfer Protocol)

Additional Information

The background check process for this position includes being fingerprinted. Fingerprints will be used to check the FBI's criminal history records.

The City does not sponsor applicants for work visas.

This job announcement is not intended to include a complete listing of all responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities associated with the position.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Position Overview:

The IT Business Systems Analyst collaborates with the staff and management of various departments and the IT team to assist with the full systems life cycle (planning, designing, developing, testing, training, launching, and supporting) of business systems in support of QuVa Pharma’s strategic vision. This individual will partner with the business and apply proven leadership, communication, analytical, project management, and technical skills to lead relevant business processes and system transformation efforts.


Responsibilities may include:

  • Translate business requirements into business solutions using ERP and related system functionality
  • Develop all necessary system requirement documentation to communicate with business sponsors, developers, and other resources involved
  • Collaborate with IT staff, business management, end users, and external consultants during all phases of planning, designing, developing, implementing, and supporting ERP and related business systems to ensure business requirements have been met
  • Effectively lead and manage the “human” side of change efforts related to business process and systems changes
  • Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including UAT, end-user reviews, for new and modified systems, and other post-implementation support
  • Develop training curriculum and conduct training sessions when needed
  • Create, document, and maintain business processes
  • Lead end user support and maintenance of specified information systems and develop strategies for continually improving these systems
  • Oversee all aspects of quality assurance including establishing metrics, applying industry best practices, and developing new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met
  • Act as key point of contact for all QA aspects of releases, providing QA services and coordinating QA resources internally and externally
  • Participate in the leading of off-shore QA resources to ensure steady output of testing needs
  • Develop, Document and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures

Qualifications:

  • Legally authorized to work in the job posting country
  • College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, computer science, accounting, or management information systems
  • 3 or more years of business analyst experience
  • Strong, hands-on knowledge of enterprise software applications – specifically Infor Syteline 9.0 preferred

To be considered:
