As a young company in a software space filled with clunky and dated interfaces, we see user experience and interface aesthetics as the foundation of our success. We’re looking for a front-end developer who can’t stand poor UX and wants to blow the minds of our customers with gorgeous pages and slick design. We want someone who doesn’t see “functional” as complete, but will strive to make new features beautiful.

RESPONSIBILITIES & OUTCOMES

  • Design and develop new user-facing features
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
  • Optimize front-end application for speed, reliability, and scalability
  • Investigate and implement new technology to keep the stack current
  • Write tests to facilitate an efficient dev cycle and a bug-free application
  • Collaborate with a small team to birth new ideas
QUALIFICATIONS

Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, cooperative, and infinitely curious. They love the challenge of designing something new and avoid regurgitating existing constructs. It’s essential that team members are able to take ideas and run with them, relying on experience and creativity.

What we use:
  • Work: Jira - Slack - Gitlab - G Suite
  • CI/CD: Gitlab CI - Docker - AWS
  • Front: TypeScript - Angular - AngularJS - D3 - SCSS - HTML
  • Back: Spring Boot - Java 8 - Kotlin - Neo4j
BENEFITS

At LogicGate, every member of our team moves the needle. With a firm footing in our core company values, we’ve built a fast-paced, demanding work culture that allows for the flexibility, autonomy, and career opportunities you’d expect from a growing company.

We offer competitive benefits including:
  • Ownership in the company through stock options
  • Comprehensive healthcare & dental plans
  • 401(k)
  • Transit benefits
  • Weekly catered lunches
  • Open-concept office space featured in ChicagoInno’s Office Envy Series
[https://www.americaninno.com/chicago/office-envy/office-envy-inside-logicgates-new-river-north-hq/]
  • Mother’s room, standing desks, company keg
  • The chance to make an immediate impact and do the best work of your life
LOGICGATE’S CORE VALUES

  • Own It - Be self-driven, entrepreneurial, and efficient
  • Raise the Bar - Challenge complacency and mediocrity; be adaptable and agile; details matter
  • Be As One - Trust, collaborate, and support; invest in co-workers and clients
  • Embrace Curiosity - Always be learning, be curious and share; be humbled but not embarrassed by mistakes
  • Do the Right Thing - Act with integrity, even when no one is looking; be transparent
  • Empower Clients - Create solutions where customers win
At LogicGate, we value diversity of culture and background for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. LogicGate is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Different makes us better.

This position is open to applicants who are legally authorized to work in the United States. We are not able to sponsor work visas at this time.

Job Description

Front-End engineers at CapTech are part of an intelligent, highly motivated community of engineers who strive to continuously learn the latest tools and architectures to deliver innovative solutions for our clients. They are involved in the design, development, and delivery of innovative web solutions in partnership with a variety of Fortune 500 clients.

CapTech’s engineers enjoy a highly collaborative environment and have many opportunities to learn from and share knowledge with other CapTech engineers, architects, and our clients.

Responsibilities

Specific responsibilities for the Senior Front-End Engineer position include:

  • Understand the challenges being addressed by an engagement and collaborate with team members, clients, and stakeholders to deliver a technical solution that meet the unique needs of our clients.
  • Help our clients maximize the value of their web presence by building accessible, high-performance web applications using the latest web standards and technologies.
  • Create quality deliverables to communicate technical solutions to appropriate audiences.
  • Design, develop, unit test, and deploy web-based solutions using common standards and frameworks.
  • Leverage CapTech’s internal programs and self-directed training to continually develop industry-relevant knowledge and skills.
  • Provide technical mentoring and leadership to more junior consultants.

Qualifications

Specific qualifications for the Senior Front-End Engineer position include:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 6+ years of demonstrated progression in standards-compliant web development (semantic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript) preferred.
  • Strong experience with JavaScript libraries and frameworks (Angular, React and Vue)
  • Understanding of performance testing and optimization techniques.
  • Ability to present technical ideas, high-level concepts, and solutions to internal and external team members with varying degrees of technical knowledge.
  • Ability to implement responsive designs and understand device-agnostic development techniques.
  • Experience developing modern session data management strategies (ngrx, Redux, and MobX).
  • Familiarity with CSS pre-processors (SASS/SCSS, Less, and Stylus).
  • Understanding of modern front-end engineering best practices (accessibility, 508/WCAG compliance, performance optimization, etc.).
  • Experience integrating with modern, industry-leading web content management platforms.
  • High proficiency with development tools and workflows (modern source control systems, unit testing, continuous workflow, etc.).

Additional Information

We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands-on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.

At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:

  • Competitive salary with performance-based bonus opportunities
  • Single and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverage
  • Short-Term and Long-Term disability
  • Matching 401(k)
  • Competitive Paid Time Off
  • Training and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursement
  • Team building and social activities
  • Mentor program to help you develop your career

CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace.

Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or “corp to corp” agreements). At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.


CapTech is a Drug-Free work place.
Candidates must have the ability to work at CapTech’s client locations.
All positions include the possibility of travel.
CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.

Python Developer Senior to Lead
Job Number: 161071

The Digital Marketing team is in need of a full stack Python developer to build an internal web application to support Digital Auctions bidding infrastructure on AWS. The candidate will work with third party vendors to consume data from their APIs and also to guide the creation and evolution of the APIs if needed. In addition, the candidate will also create a web based UI interface to support business needs. This team works with rapid development, so the developer in this role will need to be flexible in their development and execution of their artifacts. Web/BI Developer accustom to flexibility, adaptability, and creative thought in the context of development and execution will fare well in this role. Hence, strong verbal and written communication skills are required.

Goal is to use the APIs to interact with third party applications to get the current bids and send newly calculated bids back to them; while the UI will allow the business analysts to review the bids and take corrective actions if needed.

Required Skills and Experience:
  • Experience with API and Web development with Python.
  • Experience with RESTful architecture and API evolution.
  • User interface and visual design skills using React or Angular etc.,
  • Experience with relational or NoSQL databases.
  • Experience in AWS Services or any public cloud technologies for web development
  • Familiarity with business processes and systems knowledge
  • The ability to work in a team-oriented environment
  • Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities; time management and organizational skills

Preferred Skills:
  • Working knowledge of application development life cycle including CICD experience
  • Experience with more than one language such as Scala, Java etc., is a plus.
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated interest in learning new skills
  • Demonstrated ability to create and deliver communications (written and verbal) and presentations

Education and/or Experience Required:
  • Bachelor's degree in an Information Technology or Business discipline or related field of study (e.g., Computer Science, MIS, Business Management) and a minimum of 4 years designing/developing, programming and supporting software programs/applications
  • In lieu of a degree, a minimum of 6 years related work experience with two years prior analysis experience with working knowledge of designing/developing, programming and supporting software programs/applications

Our company

As one of the largest auto insurance companies in the nation, Progressive offers the confidence and stability that comes with working for a growing, always evolving organization. As an employee, you will enjoy an inclusive environment that embraces strategic thinking, drive and passion. Progressive employees also benefit from:
  • Annual gainshare bonus of up to 30% of your salary; Progressive rewards each of us with an annual bonus based on company performance
  • 401k which includes dollar-for-dollar company match of up to 6%
  • Paid training, tuition assistance and career development
  • Diverse, welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups and casual dress
  • Onsite gym and wellness programs with discounts & rewards
  • Healthcare onsite and standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)

Apply today!

Sponsorship is available for this position for candidates who already possess their H1B visa. Progressive generally does not sponsor foreign national candidates for work authorization except for positions that in Progressive’s determination require highly specialized knowledge and for which candidate sponsorship is appropriate.

Southeastern Data Cooperative (SEDC) is looking for a Software Trainer II to join our Implementation team in our Atlanta, GA office location.

About Us:

For over four decades, SEDC has been a leader in creating innovative software solutions for the utility industry. We are home to a diverse group of developers, designers, analysts, instructors, and a dedicated support team. We are always looking for talented and energetic people to add to our team!

We Offer:

  • Competitive medical benefits package including health, dental, vision, and life
  • 401(k) with up to 9% in employer contributions after 1 year
  • $4,000 for tuition reimbursement
  • Wellness reimbursement plan

Job Summary:

As a Software Trainer you will utilize your knowledge and expertise to implement and train Open One and Meridian. As the industry expert you will be responsible for helping our customers navigate a new environment. Training could take place at a customer site, web meeting, in the classroom, or on the support lines. Success in this position is defined by creating customers who are expert users and proponents of our software.

Job Description:

  • Provides group training through onsite or remote sessions
  • Creates and executes training plans; identify and schedule when different processes need to be completed
  • Communication with customer to identify training needs
  • Supports the customer during and immediately after implementation before transitioning over to Product Support
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule including 80% travel domestically; this may include some weekends Identifies and troubleshoots issues in the implementation life cycle
  • Provides support before, during and after implementation for the Data Analysts, Implementation Specialist and Project Manager as needed

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree; equivalent professional experience

  • Southeastern Data Cooperative is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all employees.

About Figure

Figure Technologies creates innovative consumer financial solutions for home improvement, debt consolidation, and retirement while providing financial literacy and financial empowerment. Our mission is to build and promote innovative financial products on blockchain that benefit consumers and eliminate rent-seeking, illiquidity, and other inefficiencies present in current financial markets.

At Figure, we build really big things. And to build big, we need a company in which everyone is supported in doing their absolute best work. That is what culture means to us. We are a team of incredibly smart people who love architecting and building things from scratch. We know we are working with the absolute best and are challenged by our colleagues every day. We are the kind of people who wake up curious each morning and go to bed each night wanting to accomplish more.

This is an amazing opportunity to be part of a startup focused on solving real problems with blockchain and to work with a team of proven leaders who have created billions of dollars in value in the Fintech space. Join us!

About the Role

Figure is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our group of talented engineers. SDETs are critical members of the team ensuring we are delivering quality products to our consumers. In this role, you'll build and utilize cutting-edge testing tools in an agile environment to plan and conduct testing of our brand new and innovative software products. We are in the early stages of development, so many of the test frameworks are not solidified. This is an opportunity to shape how we at Figure test and measure the quality of our codebases.

If you like working in a fast paced, startup environment with passionate, innovative engineers, join our team! Learn more about our Bozeman team HERE ( https://mthightech.org/figures-first-year-50-million-california-fintech-startup-brings-blockchain-technology-and-dozens-of-jobs-to-helena-and-bozeman/?mc_cid=918e5de86b&mc_eid=2fc65bdc2e )

What You'll Do

  • Learn about Figure's products and the desired customer workflow, advocating for quality and an excellent customer experience
  • Write test plans and test cases for assigned features
  • Work closely with the development team to analyze, debug and resolve any issues
  • Design and develop test plans; test cases based upon functional and design specifications
  • Contribute to a positive and collaborative team environment within Engineering and across other teams and stakeholders
  • Identify and evangelize the most effective and efficient ways to test the product
  • Influence and communicate effectively with development teams, managers and non-technical audiences including senior product and business management
  • Monitor, investigate and identify problems with production components, processes, help development diagnose and test fixes
  • Continuously look for and identify ways to improve the testing cycle and as a critical part of the SDET Team
  • Break things so we can fix them prior to launching a new product
  • Build testing frameworks to test all aspects of the application, including load testing, api testing and memory profiling
Below are the current languages and frameworks in place today:

  • Languages: Kotlin, Java, Angular/React ES6 (ECMAScript)
  • Frameworks: JIRA for project tracking, Jenkins for test automation
What We Look For

  • BS in Computer Science or related field
  • 4+ years of Quality Assurance, test engineering, or development experience, working in an agile environment
  • Ability to work collaboratively to identify and solve problems across distributed teams with strong communication skills
  • Knowledge of testing interfaces and distributed systems
  • Ability to create, execute, and properly communicate automated and manual test plans
  • Proven ability to build, maintain and configure testing environments
  • Self motivation to continue growing your skills as an Engineer and push for quality products in a fast paced environment
  • Previous experience testing cloud-based applications or distributed systems
Benefits To You

  • Competitive salary based on experience and skills
  • Firm-wide performance based bonus
  • Competitive stock options package as an early member of the team
  • A flexible paid time off and vacation policy
  • Comprehensive health, vision, dental insurance
  • Company FSA, 401k, commuter benefits
  • And much more to come!
Figure will not sponsor work visas for this position. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Job Description

CapTech’s Customer Experience (CX) team seeks a Junior Interaction Designer with a drive for creating smart, intuitive, and accessible digital products and experiences. Our Junior Interaction Designers are passionate about problem solving and strive to create elegant solutions from complex business problems. They display a proficient level of knowledge of interaction design best practices and can translate user needs into compelling wireframes and prototypes. They stay up-to-date on the latest tools, UX and design trends, and proactively seek additional learning and training in these areas.

This could be the opportunity for you if:

  • You have a solid understanding of competitive analysis, information architecture, task flows, user interface and interaction design, wireframing, prototyping.
  • You are a self-motivated strategic thinker, with the desire to provide highly creative ideas to all your engagements.
  • You thrive in an environment that requires strong problem-solving skills.
  • You enjoy collaborating with other Interaction Designers, Researchers, Developers, and Analysts.
  • You have a proven ability to meet tight deadlines, with supervision, in a fast-paced and innovative environment.

Responsibilities may include:

  • Contributing to and creating information architectures, task flows, wireframes, and prototypes that follow interaction design and usability best practices
  • Creating clean, informative, and concise presentations to clients and internal teams that communicate the rationale behind your designs
  • Consulting with clients and team members on the benefits of user experience and interaction design
  • Keeping up with interaction design trends and applying them to your recommendations
  • Researching and understanding technology trends

Qualifications

Skills and Experience desired:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to create clean, detailed, deliverables with high production value; e.g., flows, wireframes, prototypes, presentations
  • Strong conceptual and visual communication skills
  • Working knowledge of software development lifecycle and development practices is a plus
  • Proficiency in tools such as Sketch, Adobe CS, InVision, Zeplin, Omnigraffle, Axure
  • 1-3 years professional experience
  • 4-year+ degree, BA or BS in design, information sciences, HCI, or psychology

Please include a link to your online portfolio with your application in order to be considered. Strong preference for examples indicating your process.


Additional Information

We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands-on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.

At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:

  • Training and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursement

CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace.

Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or “corp to corp” agreements). At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Are you passionate about learning and intellectually curious? Do you thrive in a fast paced, innovative work environment where team members hold themselves and others accountable? Are you energized by trying new things, have an agile mindset and enjoy making an impact? If the answers to these questions are a resounding YES, then read on!

The Chief Software Architect is a strategic, hands-on leader, solving difficult data problems and then productizing those solutions. The Chief Software Architect will look at all areas across the company and will be responsible for product architecture as well as enforcing design policies and best practices.

This highly visible role is based in our Mountain View, CA office and will report to Aera’s Founder and CTO.

Please note: We are interested in considering every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, at the present time, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Responsibilities

  • Lead Aera’s efforts to solve challenging customer problems through in-depth data and predictive analytics techniques
  • Drive the overall technical architecture of Aera’s product offering including technology platforms, protocols, APIs, data and process models, persistence, runtime environments and security models
  • Anticipate and plan for issues related to customization, extension, migration, and upgrades of Aera’s customer implementations over time
  • Collaborate closely with business and engineering leadership, as well as directly with our developers to ensure adherence to the product architecture
  • Create a well-thought out strategy and manage the adoption processWork closely with IT security to monitor the company's cloud privacy standards
  • Create processes to respond to technical issues in a professional and timely mannerIdentify the top architecture solutions to successfully meet the strategic needs of Aera and our customers
  • Build, mentor and lead a small global team of highly technical architects

About You

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or related fields with a minimum of ten years of relevant experience or a Ph.D. in Computer Science or a related field with five years of relevant experience
  • At least three years of experience working as an architect on large and complex projects
  • Demonstrated success in creating the highly technical architecture of successful enterprise packaged software and SaaS platforms
  • You’re well-versed in data pipelines and realtime processing
  • You are experienced in a 24/7, multiple geography environment
  • Maintenance of direct hands on software development skills and continued personal passion of learning new languages, tools, platforms
  • You’ve worked with massive data sets, with high concurrency and performance requirements
  • You are a technical visionary with experience in researching, prototyping and recommending new solutions and products
  • Ability to work in a fast paced high growth environment utilizing a diverse range of tools and technologies

Nice to Have

  • You’ve worked in both startup and larger enterprises and enjoy the challenge of a smaller, more agile company like Aera
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Excellent trouble-shooting skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to drive features to delivery recommending new technology
  • Quick learner: able to research, learn and adapt to new and emerging technologies
At Aera (www.aeratechnology.com), we're on a mission to solve the biggest, most intractable challenges of enterprise software. We envision the rise of the Self-Driving Enterprise: a more autonomously functioning business with a central operating system that connects and orchestrates business operations. Our platform is increasingly used by the world's largest companies to identify and respond to market opportunities faster. If you share our passion for building the next generation of enterprise software and implementing it for the most sophisticated customers in the world, you’ve met your match.

Headquartered in Mountain View, California, we're growing fast, with teams in Mountain View and San Francisco (California), Bucharest and Cluj-Napoca (Romania), Paris (France), Munich (Germany), London (UK), Pune (India), and Sydney (Australia). So join us, and let’s build this! Aera Technology is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Aera Technology will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

Who We Are

npm is the world’s largest software repository, with over 10 million users and over 40 billion software package downloads every month. Our systems are critical to software engineers all over the world and used in every industry; from the public registry, which serves packages to open source engineers and small organizations, to our new enterprise solution, which provides single tenant registries for medium and large customers.

What You'll Do

Help shape npm, Inc’s success within the enterprise JavaScript community. npm is looking for a Director of Business Development to join us. In this role, you will build a partner ecosystem for npm, manage channel development, and achieve sales targets and customer satisfaction. You will focus on building relationships with those who are interested in enabling the npm community - dev tools, security providers, ML/AI, cloud and other infrastructure providers - to provide increasing value to the developers and companies building applications. The community is global, your focus will be global.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify potential npm, Inc. partners by being able to recognize and communicate mutual benefit.
  • Develop partner programs for various channel opportunities.
  • Develop on-boarding and up-leveling programs for existing partners.
  • Drive revenue and/or community building programs with every partner.
  • Create educational and community building programs that encourage participation and contribution by npm partners.
  • Develop programs that catalyze npm direct sales activity in the enterprise.
  • Work with the product team to create an insightful feedback loop.

Requirements:

  • 8+ years of channel and software sales experience, with a proven track record in business development.
  • Solid understanding of channel sales management.
  • Good network of channel partner contacts.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal relationship development skills.
  • Knowledge of the open source market a plus.
  • Ability to build mindshare and get your offering to the top of the “linecard”Ability to develop on-boarding and enablement programs that result in partner enthusiasm.
  • Motivation to achieve business objectives and goals.
Our Code of Conduct

npm exists to facilitate sharing code, by making it easy for JavaScript module developers to publish and distribute packages. npm is a piece of technology, but more importantly, it is a community. We believe that our mission is best served in an environment that is friendly, safe, and accepting; free from intimidation or harassment. We do not tolerate abusive behavior. See our unabridged code of conduct here.

Why You Should Join

In joining the npm team, you'll become an important part of a small but dedicated team who enables the world’s largest development ecosystem. We strive to provide a sensible working environment that doesn't ask for or encourage habitual overtime and we offer flexibility in schedule. We have a progressive parental leave policy and vacation time is not just encouraged, but celebrated and enforced. We also understand that healthy schedules lead to better outcomes.

We believe that high-performing teams include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can challenge each other's assumptions with fresh perspectives. To that end, we actively seek a diverse pool of applicants, including those from historically marginalized groups — women, people with disabilities, people of color, formerly incarcerated people, people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and/or gender nonconforming, first and second generation immigrants, and people from low-income families.

Where We Can Hire

Our headquarters are in Oakland, California. We can best support you if you can overlap with US time zones. We currently have team members across the US time zones and in the UK, Canada, and Mexico. We cannot currently sponsor new work visas, but we can transfer existing H-1Bs.

How I will contribute

As part of our software technology team, you are integral in advancing Asure Software's suite of Human Capital Management (HCM) products. Using your expert knowledge of object oriented design, functional programming, and best practices, you contribute design patterns and frameworks optimizing performance, stability and maintenance. Your contributions to our Asure HCM products are enhancing features that directly benefit our client’s user experience. You will collaborate with a team of engineers in a progressive environment that develops sustainable code with minimal defects in quality releases for our clients.

Joining the team as a Senior Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to deepen your knowledge and expertise in cloud technologies, Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) platforms while using existing and emerging technologies.
Technologies the team uses today: .NET, C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET, Web Forms, JavaScript, T-SQL (Stored Procedures, Functions), Crystal Reports, Web API, VB6, COM, Izenda Reporting, Mobile Development (iOS and Android)

  • You will contribute to the design and implementation of porting some of our legacy applications to more current technologies
  • Provide to the product and the team- testable, readable, maintainable and efficient code.
  • Design, develop and maintain web-based applications to enhance the performance and the stability of our current applications.
  • Design and develop service oriented architecture solutions integrating with complex database and third party components.
  • Collaborate with engineering scrum teams on best practices, code reviews and process improvements.
  • Complete development tasks that align with the current sprint commitment
  • Contribute in scrum ceremonies including the daily stand up, backlog refinement, sprint planning, sprint retrospectives and sprint reviews.
  • Participate in various agile ceremonies facilitated by the Scrum Master and Product Owner.
  • Share in the daily stand up to report: your successes from yesterday, your current day plan, and communicate roadblocks that may affect your achievements.
  • Contribute in group code reviews and to the team’s goal of continuously improving.

What I will bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent work experience also considered.
  • You have 5+ years software development experience.
  • Eligible to work in the US without sponsorship, as we are unable to sponsor or transfer Visas at this time.

Job Family Summary
The Mobile Marketing team leads the strategy, design, implementation and ongoing maintenance of consumer-facing mobile experiences to enable customers and prospects to interact with Allstate from their smartphone and other connected devices. The team focuses on meeting consumers needs by enabling self-service, deepening customer engagement, and promoting product growth by leading the development of solutions for consumer mobile applications and emerging technologies that support the Allstate brand and prominently feature Allstate Agencies. The team, within e-Business Marketing, also serves as an enterprise resource in the areas of digital engagement and e-Business.
Job Description
The Mobile Product Owner will develop and execute mobile initiatives and projects, primarily focused on the product lifecycle for Allstate branded mobile applications and other emerging mobile technologies, consistent with business strategies.

The Mobile Product Owner serves as the business product team-member working on the day-to-day implementation and development of mobile applications. He/she will be responsible for development backlog creation, backlog prioritization, story writing and acceptance and delivering business value from mobile app features and improvements.

The Mobile Product Owner will also serve as a team and company resource in the areas of mobile engagement, mobile marketing and e-Business.
Key Responsibilities
  • Work with the Product Managers to create and manage a consumer-focused product mobile roadmap, making strategic adjustments as needed based on consumer needs, resource allocation, technology delivery and corporate priority.
  • Work along side developers, architects, scrum master, business analyst, user experience, user acceptance testers and quality assurance testers to deliver mobile app code that meets business objectives
  • Represent the mobile product team in day-to-day agile scrum team meetings including:
    • Daily Stand-Ups
    • Sprint Reviews
    • Sprint and Product Integration Planning
    • Sprint Retrospectives
    • Backlog refinement & grooming sessions
    • Product demonstrations
  • Designs and implements new programs, services and approaches that meet connected consumer needs.
  • Works along side Product Manager to collaborate and contribute on product strategy and strategic decisions.
Key Responsibilities (Cont'd)
  • Manage analytics and performance reporting.
  • Liaison with key members of the marketing organization on communication programs that raise awareness and drive usage of the mobile self-service channel.
  • Analyzing market intelligence and business results to translate emerging trends into business opportunities, as well as identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies as appropriate.
  • Participates in the management of vendor relationships and ensures information flows between business teams and vendor for successful completion of projects.
  • Staying abreast of digital media consumption and technology trends in mobile and related areas to serve as a subject matter expert and resource to internal stakeholders.
  • Identifying emerging trends in connected automobile technology and adoption.
Key Responsibilites (Cont'd)
  • Cross-functional, individual contributor role that involves presenting the strategic product roadmap to multiple stakeholders, collaborating on features and obtaining buy-in on application design.
  • Supports and executes more complex mobile marketing campaigns intended to drive customer engagement including app personalization & content marketing, in-app messaging campaigns, push messaging campaigns and engagement strategies to drive app usage, feature adoption & cross-sell from existing app users.
  • Manages deep linking capabilities and customer feedback tools.
  • Supports and executes app user acquisition campaigns by working closely with MARA and Consumer Marketing on download campaigns, supporting internal marketing efforts in liaison with digital team, and executing App Store Optimization & Search programs.
  • Production Support liaison.
Job Qualifications
  • The successful candidate will have at least 3 – 5 years of relevant experience
  • Ideally 1-2 years in a mobile environment
  • Familiarity with and affinity for agile development, collaboration and test-and-learn environments
  • Passionate about delivering mobile solutions that exceed expectations.
  • Ability to effectively understand data, analyze results, draw insights and conclusions, and recommend appropriate actions in an atmosphere of fact-based decision-making;
  • Proven ability to work in collaborative, matrixed environment.
  • Proven expertise in marketing, with specific experience in digital marketing, including e-commerce;
  • Strong consumer disposition with ability to define and communicate consumer-centric business requirements to technical and non-technical audiences;
  • Excellent communication and story-telling skills, including the ability to effectively translate and communicate technical information in a meaningful way to non-technical audiences;
  • Solid product/service development experience;
  • Demonstrate a collaborative approach to achieving business results;
Job Qualifications (Cont'd)
  • Experience in telematics, automotive, or internet of things is desired, but not required
  • Experience in social networks and mobile applications is desired, but not required
  • Multi-channel experience is desired

Other skills required:
  • Understanding of mobility and mobile apps
  • Understanding of technology and emerging smartphone capabilities
  • Team player who can blend business and technology
  • Knowledge of JIRA is a plus

Educational Background:
  • Bachelor's Degree, Master’s preferred

Job Description

Allstate’s strategy continues to put a growing focus on data and technology as we continue our digital transformation journey. This has created numerous opportunities in the technology organization to find work that is meaningful to you. We’re building innovative products here, in our own labs. The Content Management & Search (CMS) team is responsible for supporting multiple platforms: web content management, digitial asset management, and search. CMS team members partner with a diverse group of clients – ranging from teams that support Allstate.com to teams that support customer information across all channels. The Search application developer plays a critical role in the solution lifecycle including: responding to feature and configuration requests, designing solutions, envisioning follow up work, and taking ownership of operational excellence of the Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities
  • Implementation and support of Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr solutions.
  • Document detailed design, functional and technical specifications in developing Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr solutions.
  • Exhibit expertise in Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr architecture and the demonstrated competency to design, deploy and support solutions in a shared services architecture.
  • Develop, execute, and document procedures and standards adhering to SDLC best practices including the Agile Scrum methodology.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues, perform root cause analysis and take appropriate action to remediate issues.
  • Participates in the discovery phase of projects to determine high level design.
  • Analyzes business needs and develops plans to implement software requirements in conjunction with product management and architects.
  • Independently handles high impact, critical software/systems monitoring issues and tickets/ incidents.
  • Troubleshoots business and production issues.
  • Mentors and coaches junior developers in Lucidworks Fusion and Apache Solr solutions.
  • Collaborates with other technologists as a member of a broad, cross-functional team motivated to solve business problems.
Job Qualifications
  • 1 year of experience with Lucidworks Fusion and/or open source search engines Apache Solr, Lucene, or Elasticsearch.
  • Experience with building scalable, high performing and robust Java and/or .NET applications.
  • Advanced scripting skills in at least one of the following: Puppet, Perl, Python, Bash, or Unix Shell and willingness to learn new technologies.
  • Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g., GitHub).

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or experience in closely related field
Preferred Competencies
  • Experience developing specifically with Apache Solr
  • Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (e.g., Jenkins, Artifactory Pro, SonarQube, Selenium, Jmeter, and so forth).
  • Experience with some or all of Apache, JBoss / Tomcat, or other application servers.
  • Experience with Node JS, AngularJS, Bootstrap or other web-based frameworks.
  • Exposure to Spark

Senior Developer and Application Architect Claims

Our direct client has an immediate opening for a Senior Developer and Application Architect supporting its implementation of the Duck Creek Insurance Platform. The position is in our Boston, MA office. They provide commercial property, casualty, healthcare professional liability, surety, executive and professional lines insurance to global customers. They are in the process of implementing a long range technology platform strategy with the Duck Creek policy, claims and billing modules being a cornerstone.

Note: All those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. Our client is able to transfer H1B visas and sponsor GC process.

Summary

They are looking to fill a role leading the technical architecture and development of major components of our Claims platform. Expectations include splitting time between architecting solutions, hands-on development of complex capabilities, and directing the technical configuration work of others. The role will work closely with the IT leadership team and our vendor partners from requirements through rollout.


Duties & Responsibilities

Work closely with the senior technical resources and global partners, to interpret and translate business requirements into solution technical designs.
Actively participate in configuration of the Claims solution. Completing critical configuration activities and solving the most complex problems.
Analyze complex technical or systems problems; design and implements effective solutions.
Work with technical staff to understand problems with software and develop specifications for improvements and enhancements.
Take a leadership role in developing technical scope, approach and implementation estimates.
Collaborate with the business to ensure proper understanding of the functional needs and how they translate into solution designs.
Develop overall application architecture and technical design deliverables for the Claim modules.
Engage in the assignment of work to development team resources, ensuring effective transition of knowledge, design assumptions and development expectations.
Establish processes that will facilitate the development of an integrated solution by disparate resources (employees and contractors) that will work from different locations.
Provide on-call support as needed.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Minimum of eight years of experience developing and delivering complex technology solutions.
Experience in developing technology solutions in support of Commercial Insurance Claim solutions.
Considered an expert by your peers in architecting solutions and configuring functionality within a Claims platform.
Guidewire or Duck Creek Claims is required.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, adept at working with remote IT teams.
Strong background in P&C Insurance.
Hands on style with strong problem solving abilities and a keen attention to detail.

Our way is to take the path less traveled and do something new and creative. We work in a lot of different technology stacks and try to expand into new ones as the opportunity arises. Who We Are

First thing you need to know; Bestow is not your typical insurance company. We’ve completely reimagined industry assumptions, and harnessed technology and big data to create life insurance products that aren’t just delightful to use but deliver on our mission: to make financial products accessible to more people than ever before.

Check us out at hellobestow.com

Who We’re Looking For

“Innovative” and “disruptive” can be overused words. But at Bestow, it isn’t jargon, it’s an everyday rally cry. We are rewriting the rules of the 400-year-old, $7 trillion life insurance industry, serving communities who have been underserved in the past, and we believe the future is a bright one.

So, if you’re excited by the idea of being a part of a well funded startup, working at a mission-driven company and fundamentally shaking up an age-old industry, please read on.

As a Senior Python Engineer you will lead development on new features and technical improvements for our products. You should be able to define technical design and implement work independently. You should have prior experience architecting systems.

Bestow software engineers are great teammates. You are willing to collaborate with other software engineers, product managers and designers. You also have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Do you want to build products to reinvent a centuries old industry? If so, we'd love to hear from you.

Challenges on which you can expect to work:

Building Product Features

We're a startup with a long product roadmap. You'll be working with a team to make that roadmap a reality.

Develop new product features using Python 3, Go, and PostgreSQL;
Resolve issues with previously delivered features;
Write unit and integration tests for code you create;
Peer review code developed by others on your team;
Ensure software is secure, maintainable and extensible;
Collaborate with designers, product managers and other engineers.

Ensuring a Robust Software Platform

Great software is more than product features. It simultaneously considers non-functional concerns like security, maintainability and extensibility. You are responsible for ensuring:

The security of our applications including participation in external penetration tests, threat modeling and secure code review;
Use modern extensibility methodologies such as feature toggles;
Automation of routine developer workflows such as environment setup.

Fostering Best Practices

We might be small but we've got big ambitions. Folks joining the team will be defining our software engineering culture. You are someone that strives to build a premier engineering organization.

Measure test coverage and gradually improve the metrics;
Leave code in a better place than it was when you started;
Encourage automation and continuous improvement.

A Little About You

  • 4+ years of back end software development experience
  • Professional experience with Python 3; Experience with Flask a plus
  • Professional experience with a relational database like PostgreSQL
  • Experience with strongly typed languages (Golang, Kotlin, Rust, etc)
  • Experience using Docker for local software development
  • Experience designing APIs (Protocol Buffers, RAML, Swagger, OpenAPI, etc)
  • Experience with distributed systems and microservices
  • A champion for Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
  • Clear, concise written and verbal communication
  • A desire and willingness to learn
  • Initiative and motivation to make things happen

What We Can Offer to You

  • Competitive salary
  • Generous PTO
  • Flexible schedule and work/life balance
  • 100% company-paid health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Choose your own computer setup (Mac or PC)
  • Office snacks and weekly team lunches
  • Team building events and activities

Purpose

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team of Engineers in the beautiful Buckhead, GA location. This position will play a key role in the on-going delivery of diverse and leading edge Craneware products that help our customers realize Revenue Integrity in the Hospitals across the United States.

Involved in the whole software lifecycle, we require pioneering and inventive personalities in many areas from Enterprise Architecture, User Interface Design, Data Management and Security and Quality Assurance.

You will be responsible for analyzing requirements and recommending solutions based on the current architecture. You will lead projects and provide technical support to your peers throughout the team.
Craneware lives its values of Honesty, Integrity, Hard Work, Excellent Service, and ‘Enjoying the Challenge’. Guided by these principles, we continue to design and develop high quality and successful products, while working in a great environment that fosters teamwork while providing ample room for learning and professional growth.

Office Location: Atlanta
Position Status: Full Time
Visa Sponsorship: The Company will not sponsor any individuals for a work visa

Key Accountabilities

  • Work within an agile delivery team to contribute to the design and development of software releases using the Craneware Application Lifecycle Management (CALM) methodology.
  • Design well architected, maintainable solutions using appropriate design principles for example design patterns and SOLID principles.
  • Investigate and resolve software defects to provide timely resolutions.
  • Ensure sufficient code coverage of deliverables by the use of automated tests.
  • Contribute towards defining Engineering Software Standards and Best Practices.
  • Review peer code against Craneware development standards to ensure high quality code and consistency.
  • Work with product management to provide technical solutions to meet product requirements.
  • Provide technical leadership by supporting, training and mentoring software engineers.
  • Lead process and Craneware standard improvements, such as CALM.
  • Provides direct line management for approximately two Engineers and Apprentices.
  • Participate in technical recruitment.
  • Keep up to date with technical advances to drive innovation.

Desired Skills and Experience

Education:
  • Educated to Degree level and 3+ years of commercial experience working in a Software Engineering role or alternatively 5+ years of commercial experience working in a Software Engineering role.
Knowledge:
  • In-depth knowledge and expertise in at least one core area of software engineering, with a basic awareness of additional core areas. An in-depth understanding of automated testing methods and their application.
  • Working knowledge of Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools (e.g. TFS or Jira).
  • In-depth understanding of Craneware Application Lifecycle Management methodology and Craneware software standards.
  • An in-depth understanding of software principles for example SOLID principles and design patterns and how to apply them.
  • Good understanding of software architecture.
  • Awareness of release management processes and tools.
Skills
  • Ability to analyze and solve technical problems.
  • Ability to clearly articulate ideas to target audience.
  • Ability to collaborate with other team members within a Craneware Agile Delivery team.
  • Proven experience in mentoring less experienced developers.
  • Proven understanding of the use of source control.
Experience
  • Proven experience of managing fast-paced small teams that follow agile methodologies with at least 1+ year in a management capacity, or equivalent proven skill set and ability.
  • Proven track record in designing and building quality software solutions.
  • 1+ years’ experience in one or more database technologies (e.g. SQL, non-relational) including data modelling and performance.

Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone.

At the heart of that mission are the people that work here—the dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation.

That’s because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn’t be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don’t just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.

The Team

Our engineers are fueled by a passion to impact the future of mobility. They push the boundaries of telematics and transportation tech by creating and supporting cutting-edge products. As part of an Agile team, the Arity Sensor Development team develops cutting edge, digital consumer-facing products that help Arity capture relevant data to improve transportation safety and efficiencies. The embedded software engineering team works as part of the digital design team, and creates the embedded software that brings the hardware to life. Using a variety of languages and a top-notch technology stack, our engineers make critical advances in areas like sensor technology, enterprise engineering and platform development. Our team understands what it means to collaborate and communicate in an interconnected global team, all while having trust, transparency and empathy for the end user. Which is pretty cool, if you ask us.

The Role

The Senior Embedded Engineer works with the digital design engineers to evaluate and recommend the right software to enable the features of the product. The Senior Embedded Engineer also mentors junior engineers and helps ensure the team is using the best practices for creating embedded applications. This team also writes software to allow the hardware to be manufactured and tested to ensure that the products are being built properly and that the hardware is functional

Using common embedded software development tools such as JTAG or serial debuggers, BIST and emulators, this engineer writes the embedded software and debugs it on the hardware or development boards. He/she actively participates in the decision-making process of the team ensuring that the best appropriate technology and design is chosen to meet product needs. He/she coaches other team members, creating an environment of continuous learning, and constantly challenging and stretching the knowledge of the team.


Responsibilities

  • Use Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) and debuggers to create and debug low-level, embedded applications and drivers on micro-controllers and microprocessors.
  • Understand the challenges of battery-operated and low voltage embedded devices in order to write efficient embedded applications.
  • Understand and utilize the features of embedded compilers and linkers to create small and efficient applications.
  • Understand software libraries and how to integrate functionality from various libraries.
  • Be able to integrate and use wireless technology such as Bluetooth and WiFi in embedded applications and networking technology.
  • Be intimately familiar with best embedded architecture and design methodologies including RTOS, and be able to mentor other team members.
  • Support the design of the microprocessor-based circuitry (hardware/software co-design).
  • Leads and participates in daily site, cross-site, and product team standups
  • Participates in the effort of shaping the architecture and design of the product; actively helps the team in choosing the right technology and solving technical problems.
  • Coaches the team and leads daily practices of writing software and building products
  • Provides support for software products in user environments
  • Leads and participates in knowledge sharing, and contributes to the overall growth of the collective knowledge of the development community.
Qualifications
  • Bachelors degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent combination of education and technical experience
  • Professional experience developing firmware/software for embedded control systems in real-time product applications
  • Code skills in C/C++ languages
  • Experience with GIT source code management system.
  • Experience with wireless communication protocols and networking technologies.
  • 5+ years of developing and implementing embedded systems.
  • Hands on experience on modern embedded software development tools such as JTAG debuggers, source level debuggers, GNU compilers, and similar technologies
  • Knowledge and experience in testing embedded applications and integration into larger systems.
  • Experience with vehicle diagnostic systems and protocols a plus.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

That’s the day-to-day, now let’s talk about the rest of it. As we mentioned, Arity was founded by The Allstate Corporation. But you’ll be working for—and at—Arity. It’s the best of both worlds. You’ll get access to the full suite of Allstate benefits and work in a fast-paced startup culture. That’s more than just free breakfasts, brain breaks and ping pong. It’s a culture that encourages you to be you.


Sound like a fit? Apply now! We can’t wait to meet you.


Arity.com Instagram Twitter LinkedIn

Job Brief

The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the processes established to respond to requests from utilities and independent developers for new generation and transmission interconnections with the transmission systems operated by SRP. This includes SRP's solely-owned transmission system as well as the participation project jointly-owned systems operated by SRP. This candidate will serve as the liaison between SRP and the requesting entity. Under timelines established in SRP's Open Access Transmission Tariff or in participation project procedures, the candidate will work across department lines to direct the completion of technical studies, development of plans of service and construction cost estimates and the drafting of agreements necessary to respond to such requests. The candidate will be responsible for presenting the status of interconnection requests to the Engineering & Operating (E&O) Committees for the jointly-owned transmission participation projects. As needed, the candidate will also be involved with specific issues related to the participation projects, which may include preparation of procedures, responding to action items generated at the E&O meetings, and other duties as assigned.

Job Responsibilities
  • Performs engineering design work and engineering studies.
  • Performs as engineering project leader.
  • Prepares specifications and evaluates bids.
  • Prepares recommendation material for management consideration.
  • Administers and reviews work performed by consultants and others.
  • Prepares and/or conducts written and oral reports and presentations.
  • Performs field engineering work
  • Performs engineering analyses.
  • Design and/or codes computer programs.
Education
Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering from an ABET accredited curriculum or State Professional Engineering Registration.
Experience

Five (5) years full time experience actively engaged in engineering practice. Must have demonstrated the successful accomplishment of work of the nature defined for the job of Senior Engineer.

Promotion to Level 2 requires a minimum of two years of experience at Level 1; demonstrated capability to perform advanced and more difficult work as determined by the supervisor. Promotion to Senior Level requires a minimum of three years of experience at Level 2; is fully competent in all aspects of functional area of assignment and as such would be recognized as a specialist in area of assignment and may have periodic or occasional lead responsibilities.

Additional Information

Responsible for project budgets and schedules. Occasional contacts with customers and outside agencies. Contacts with suppliers of equipment and services. Occasional travel to suppliers facilities, industry organizational functions and SRP facilities. Ability to work effectively with various organizational groups within SRP. Ability to use engineering tools required for the job (i.e., computer, test equipment, etc.).


  • Knowledge of transmission system assets
  • Knowledge of substation design
  • Familiarity with engineering drawings
  • Ability to interpret and review transmission System Impact Studies
  • Ability to interpret and review Facilities Studies
  • Contract analysis, development and negotiation
  • Understanding and preparation of budgets
  • Experience with SAP
  • Ability to interface with customers
  • Oral and written communication skills
  • Presentation skills
  • Process development, enhancement and documentation
Certifications or Testing Required
Must possess the appropriate valid Arizona driver’s license.

Primary Purpose:

Analyze statistical, financial, and competitive information to help make pricing, underwriting, agency management, distribution, and claims decisions.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

Product R&D Analyst I

  • Execute and assist with analytic projects in support of Product Development and Analytics objectives
  • Utilize advanced programming techniques to efficiently meet project goals
  • Assist in implementation of models for insurance loss, conversion, retention, and price optimization
  • Communicate with business leaders and staff across functions
  • Design and manipulate large datasets across platforms

Product R&D Analyst Senior

  • Investigate new databases and develop subject matter expertise
  • Identify and architect solutions for data challenges
  • Work with team resources to define project plans and timelines
  • Research issues/defects and collaborate with business resources and developers to determine the appropriate solutions
  • Research and respond to ad hoc requests supporting team objectives
  • Develops and implements new databases, reports, dashboards or analytics for use across the enterprise

Minimum Skills and Competencies:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experience
  • 4+ years of experience working with and analyzing data in an office setting
  • Strong programming skills, specifically in SAS and/or SQL
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
  • Must possess effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to project deadlines

Desired Skills:

  • P&C insurance industry background with working knowledge of automotive insurance
  • Understanding of insurance product design and mathematical underpinnings of rating algorithms
  • Graduate degree in statistics or related field
  • Strong analytic skills, especially in predictive modeling and data mining techniques
  • Expertise with other statistical software
  • Some VBA programming or demonstrated ability to learn

Role Summary:

    The Data Engineering team is looking for a motivated individual who is able to identify analytical insights from the data and support data engineers and visualization specialists to help seek challenges in supply chain environment. He or She will work with the team to build state-of-the-art data and analytics driven solutions, working across GE to drive business analytics to a new level of predictive analytics while using big data tools and technologies.

    Essential Responsibilities:

    The Analytics Engineer will be part of a data engineering cross-disciplinary team on internally and commercially-facing development projects, typically involving large, complex data sets. These teams typically include statisticians, computer scientists, software developers, engineers, product managers, and end users, working in concert with partners in GE business units including but not limited to supply chain, services, engineering, and finance. The Analytics Engineer will work with Data engineers on all aspects of data acquisition, data transformation, and will be responsible for analytics and data science outcomes. In addition, the Analytics Engineer will:

  • Acquire domain Subject Matter Expertise (Supply Chain, Engineering, etc.) across IT systems by working closely with business partners, detailing findings centrally
  • Write queries that are able to transform, pivot, and stitch big data sets, both relational and non relational
  • Write custom scripts in Python, Java, R or Spark to transform and pivot data
  • Build, operationalize and scale data science algorithms to very large datasets
  • Identify analytics opportunities and communicate with product owners

    • Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree from an Accredited University or College
  • Must be willing to travel
  • Must be willing to work out of an office located in Cincinnati, Ohio

    Eligibility Requirement:

  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job.

    • Desired Characteristics:

    DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Quantitative Analytics, Statistics, Information Technology, or STEM ((Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
  • Experience in statistical linear models, data mining and machine learning principles.
  • Hands-on experience with streaming data architecture (Spark Streaming, message queues, etc.)
  • Experience with Agile project delivery frameworks
  • Experience with enterprise data visualization technologies (Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience working with cloud and big data technologies
  • Experience working on relational SQL databases (PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc.).
  • Experience in statistical data analysis and data mining packages (R, Python, SAS, MATLAB)

    BUSINESS INSIGHT:

  • Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems
  • Skilled in breaking down problems, detailing problem statements and estimating efforts
